author: {'steamid': '76561198081623099', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 685, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 684, 'last_played': 1609161468}
review: An unique gem - I really enjoyed playing this game and the art style is just beautiful. A talented voice cast also brings the characters to life. Hope we don't have to wait too long for part 2!

author: {'steamid': '76561198327119200', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1609131076}
review: This game is perfect for those who love mystery novels or any type of mystery solving game/puzzle.  I have read different reviews on the slower paced walking and although this game does seem to have a lot of walking/slower-paced answering,  it is not too slow to where it makes the game unplayable, there seems to be a running option throughout,  and the slower paced moving makes it to where you can actually sit back and enjoy the story without feeling rushed. Having slow walking is a pro in a mystery game, in opinion, so you can pick up different clues along the way if needed or just to see the scenery the creator has developed. Overall, great game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198344888996', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 42, 'playtime_forever': 777, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 777, 'last_played': 1608992684}
review:
A difficult game to review. It's very simple, with almost no challenge in the puzzles - making it feel like "my first adventure"... great if you want to intro the kids to point-n-click. For a regular gamer it gets repetitive very quickly and eventually annoying.
But I can't give it a bad review - because the characters, writing, voice-acting and graphic styles are clearly a work of love from the creators - they are excellent throughout. Likewise the story within a story presentation, the narrative of the adventure itself are very good. You also get about 10hours - admittedly some of that walking needlessly long distances but most of it actual content - which felt good value.
What you're left with then is one of those 'Disney Movies' that just about has enough to entertain the grown-ups but is clearly for the kids. You don't mind that you watched it but would have liked more substance. As a game for my holiday hang-overs it was ideal!
Like others have said - it also just ends - suddenly and with no satisfying resolve at all. I think it needs a clear "Part One" stamp on it, because I had no idea this wasn't a complete game - it was very disappointing.
If you enjoy a walking simulator, with some 'choices matter' bits and a beautiful cartoon style - give it a go. If you need puzzles, this is not going to satisfy you at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993485063', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 627, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 627, 'last_played': 1608349841}
review: I'm giving this a Thumbs Down even though I played through the whole thing and enjoyed parts of it. There are some really nice elements to Jenny LeClue, I think the story framing is well done, I think there is just enough personality to it, and I think the two threads of the mystery are pretty engaging. The issues I have are more to do with the game play and pacing. There is a lack of variety in puzzles, many use repeated formats such as the lock picking, breaking boards, the dial puzzles, and the wave frequency puzzles; solving them once was fine but repeating the puzzles with similar solutions was tedious. Moving around the environment often felt too slow, the story cutscenes are not skippable and they do not give you text speed options. Then the cherry on top of this all is that they decided not to even give a full conclusion to the game! I tried to go back and see if your choices gave different outcomes and the don't and it was REALLY cumbersome trying to get additional achievements. I think there are some easy tweaks that could make this game something like an 8/10 but in the current state I would give it a 6/10 at best.

author: {'steamid': '76561198143807861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 937, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1608588071}
review: This game is NOT a complete story. Huge let-down. Ending a detective game on a cliffhanger is one thing- but discarding the entire plot in the end? Makes me have buyer's remorse for sure. If you choose to buy this game, beware: you will have to spend more money just to finish the story that the first game should have finished.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011160772', 'num_games_owned': 379, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 801, 'last_played': 1607888239}

author: {'steamid': '76561198426428291', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 882, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 882, 'last_played': 1607128892}
review: This game is too charming and well-done not to recommend.  Story, graphics, voice acting - all outstanding.  But, gameplay is slow (sooo much walking and pressing enter) and puzzles are very easy.  This is really a pre-teen/teen game more than an adult game. There's nothing wrong with that - just be aware. That said, I'm pretty curious to see how the story ends in the next game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198100748279', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 714, 'last_played': 1696720467}
review: Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is truly entertaining. The heroine is sarcastic and witty. I enjoyed the bit of comedy throughout the story. The game play is fairly linear, with some choices here and there. There are some extra collectables, too (bonus items that I had fun looking around for). I enjoyed the game. The music is fun and fits in well. The character interactions were amusing. The only downside is that the game ends as a "To Be Continued" story. I would have preferred to have had a completed game to play; I don't want to have to wait for a continuation to be released. Overall, I do recommend the game. It was fun!

author: {'steamid': '76561198047333977', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 1460, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 863, 'last_played': 1610505660}
review:
When Part 2 is released, Iâ€™ll edit this to add a review for that as well.

[b][Non-Spoiler for Part 1][/b]

The art for the environments and characters is stunning, plus great voice acting and animations. Iâ€™m glad I got the game when they updated it with full voice acting. The music is also fantastic, and (more or less) appropriate for the sci-fi 40s-50s time period it seems to take place in.

The tone going from light-hearted to semi-dark without blood or supernatural elements was refreshing. The story reminded me of the ones from the mid-1900s, Nancy Drew, Twilight Zone, etc. with a meta-side conflict with the writer.

I bought this on sale, but the $20 price tag is well deserved for 10 hours+ worth of story, voice acting and gameplay. 

In terms of critique, I have to echo a few reviews that said it would be nice to have keyboard and mouse support. While moving Jenny in the environment with wasd is fine, when it comes to looking for clues or breaking down barriers, itâ€™s awkward to move the diamond cursor around the area and select small areas.

review: Cute game, lots of gameplay.  I would play the next one in this series.  I was not a big fan of all keyboard movement but adapted.  The story is interesting.  Sometimes the cut scenes were a bit long but some provided some laugh-worthy comments.  For the most part the game seemed to be  more for younger players but it still held my interest. author: {'steamid': '76561198030669842', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 657, 'last_played': 1606729081}
review:
This game barely gets a recommendation, since there are many things I find annoying about it. But let's start with...

The Good:
- The characters are great, both from a design and from a personality point of view.
- The story - while not what I expected - got interesting eventually.
- The whole game is polished and professionally made.

The Bad:
- I'm not quite sure who this game is for. The puzzles are too easy for most adults, but the dark tone of some scenes is not approriate for children.
- The story has serious pacing issues. They should have cut the whole middle chunk where all you do is walk around and do the same mini-games over and over. It also ends on a cliffhanger, which I thought was unnecessary.
- The game is a completionist's nightmare. You're expected to search every nook and cranny for collectibles. However, sometimes the game moves to the next chapter when you walk a certain way, so you can't finish looking everywhere. I guess I'm supposed to replay all the chapters, but considering the pacing issues already mentioned, I definitely won't do that.
- The keyboard controls work, but I would have preferred using the mouse for puzzles.

The Verdict: If you want a mystery story with interesting characters, then consider this game. However, if boring stretches make you quit a game, then stay away. Also, if you want all achievements, you'll need some serious patience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093653878', 'num_games_owned': 297, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 966, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1668850679}
review:
Cute artstyle, charming characters and genuinely compelling mysteries, Jenny LeClue is a must for anyone who is even remotely interested in the genre. 

Jenny is also the most precious, sassiest lass in fiction. Absolutely top tier protagonist.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017614297', 'num_games_owned': 557, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 658, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 658, 'last_played': 1606533398}
review:
With its endearing protagonist, colorful characters, engaging puzzles that (mostly) don't overstay their welcome, and an often-beautiful stylized setting, Jenny Leclue makes for a good few evenings of pleasant adventure-game company.

Though the story ends in a devilish cliffhanger that might leave some feeling short-changed, I'm invested enough to look forward to the continuation of Jenny's adventure. My primary complaints would be that the game could do with a dialogue-skip option for those revisiting chapters for achievement-hunting, and those chapters could be broken up better by checkpoints; however, it's hard not to find oneself smiling even when replaying them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198326325032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1032, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1627401871}
review:
I had so much fun playing this game! Jenny LeClue is a cozy and thrilling adventure/mystery game with an art-style and theme that reminds me of the Adventures of Tintin, Gravity Falls and Scooby Doo! Mystery Inc.

The game is narrated by the author of the in-universe Jenny LeClue books and while I did think some of the narrations got a bit long during cutscenes (since you can't move until they're finished) I also think they added a lot to the game's feeling thanks to the great voice acting.

I was also genuinely surprised by a lot of the darker themes in the game and even found myself on edge during some of those segments. Now I'm just standing-by, hoping for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197968095656', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1605502897}
review:
Mostly a fairly linear interactive story with puzzle, deduction, and decision-making bits.  I really enjoyed the story telling though, it's suspenseful, exciting, and headed in surprising directions.  Voice acting is solid and the whole production feels fairly polished.

Some of the walking starts to get a bit tedious and the one thing that disappointed me is that the magnifying glass mechanic feels a bit like a gimmick since you are prompted to use it.  That turns out to be necessary since you can't at all see many of things that it reveals.

author: {'steamid': '76561198832742723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 137, 'playtime_forever': 406, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 406, 'last_played': 1604832998}
review:
[h1]Cute yet mysterious...[/h1]

The story started with a very relatable author, Arthur K. Finklestein, pestered by his editor to spice up his wholesome Nancy Drew-ish mystery series. For his 38th book in the series, Jenny would not be track down any missing kittens or misplaced diaries â€” instead, she will find herself tasked with solving a real-deal murder, after one of the Arthurton's most prominent men winds up dead under shady circumstances. And this time, the fate of her family and friends hangs in the balance. These opening scenes establish Jenny LeClue's tone right off the bat â€” wry, self-aware, and thankfully never too pleased with its own cleverness.

What I really love about this game is that there are interactive dialog options where we can choose over the course of Jenny's journey. Some of them are in clear defiance of what Arthur wants for the characters and choosing those will get a comment from him as well, which is a really nice touch. The game even keeps track of all the choices you made and assigns Jenny a personality type to go along with them depending on how you have her react in different situations.

However, on the subject of endings, I was kind of [i]unhappy[/i] with how this game ended. It really feels like things are just ramping up and we have finally uncovered something so big that there is no way that it could be ended so abruptly!? 

Overall, Jenny LeClue - Detectivu is a mystery that I would love to recommend to everyone, but that recommendation is forced to come with a precaution that this game ends so suddenly, especially in the moment when things finally starting to get really wild and exciting.
 

[b]TL; DR

ğŸ–¼ï¸ Beautiful visuals and colors
ğŸ¤ Excellent vocal performances
ğŸ–‹ï¸ Consistently clever writing
ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ¤â€ğŸ§‘ Well-Written Plot & Characters Development

author: {'steamid': '76561198139549446', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1059, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 861, 'last_played': 1609577853}
review:
I really loved my first playthrough of Jenny LeClue. Now I'm back to check out the updates. So far really impressed with the voice acting!

I really love the vibe this games creates. The meta eye rolling between the Protagonist and the Narrator is hilarious. And the atmosphere (which varies from autumnal Americana to biting suspense to palpably haunting) is to die for!

author: {'steamid': '76561198116858193', 'num_games_owned': 117, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 545, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 545, 'last_played': 1604976400}
review:
I have really mixed feelings about the game
Pros : 
- Beautifull game with very nice moods 
- the interrogation phases were short and straight forwards
- The mini game puzzle were logic
- The story is charming, I liked the back and forth between the book and the writer
Cons
- The game was waaaaay too easy and never gave me any challenge.
Everything is served to you on a gold platter and the game do too much for you. 
For xemple, I would have loved to have to remember the code I found and enter it myself in the computer, but instead Jenny do it on her own.
- The tells too much when and where to search, observation is not really rewarded

Finally the choices seemed useless in many cases.

I was maybe expecting too much or I was not the target market, seems more appropriate for younger children that are not yet used to play point and click games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059358712', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 746, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 746, 'last_played': 1604985422}
review:
This is a very conditional recommendation. The core of this game is the story and it does an incredibly good job when it comes to that story. I kept wanting to know what happens next, and I think that the characters came off as genuine and there was solid character growth. I also really liked the meta narrative with the narrator. 

However, I'm not reviewing a book, I'm reviewing a game, and as far as the game aspects go, it falls incredibly short. Most of the time when I had agency it wasn't interesting, it just felt like fluff until I get to the next bit of story. I mostly enjoyed the puzzles, but the platforming was very linear and didn't really give any sense of exploration that I feel like a good mystery should have. There were a couple of times where I just wanted to stop playing the game because I was just sick of the platforming sections. There might be optional things I didn't find, but I doubt it. The game seemed to gate me off from moving forward until I found everything of interest.

I can also tell that there's a lot of passion and love put into this project, and the artwork is very stylized, and probably the best part of what makes it a game.  Overall, I feel like this game would have worked better in a visual novel format, with puzzles mixed in from time to time, and probably would've been easier and cheaper to make that way considering the existence of RenPy.

TLDR: If you want a good story, then buy this. If you want something with amazing gameplay, look somewhere else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198132019728', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 100, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 100, 'last_played': 1604295139}
review:
Pros:
The art design is absolutely stunning.

Cons:
Everything else

I wanted so badly to like this! 

But the whole experience was a mixture of boredom and frustration.

It's really more like a visual novel, as others have said. The level of player interaction is SO LOW. The story pace is incredibly slow. There is no subtlety or sophistication. It feels designed for kids or teens. There are all kinds of hokey bloating. Figure out what this person ate for breakfast. It doesn't matter! Who cares! It is just bizarre and frustrating. It also has really long cut scenes of characters talking where you can't pause and they are so flipping boring. OMG. UGHHHHHHH.
There is no mouse support. They controls are redundant (you have to click certain items with a magnifying glass to 'see' them and then click them AGAIN to actually look at them. The puzzles are not challenging in the slightest. It's just excruciating. 
There are options where you can choose between two things. But the VAST majority of these choices seem to have NO IMPACT on what happens AT ALL.
After a couple hours, I was literally like, on god, no, don't make me talk to some other boring person for 10 minutes. AGHHGHHGHGHGHG.

I found the main character to be absolutely annoying! I didn't like her AT ALL! She was so obnoxious. I also didn't love her voice acting which I'm sure influenced it.

The frame concept of the writer telling the story is interesting but why is it needed? It really seems like the value is to justify future endless installments of the game? It doesn't really add anything. Why do we need an adult man 'creating' this girl's story? Why can't she just exist without a dude controlling her, on her own terms? *Frown*

It's a shame that something with such gorgeous production value totally falls apart on plot, pacing, interaction, gameplay and editing. 

Also why are her feet so small?

author: {'steamid': '76561198011600042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 755, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1604320161}
review: A high-quality stylish game with a very twisted spy sci-fi plot and about 11 hrs of gameplay, but would be more interesting for kids than for adults. Puzzles are repetivie and pretty simple, don't give any mind challenge at all. I enjoyed this game more like a kid's cartoon with vivid characters, lots of humor and great design and music, than a puzzle game. Similar to Night in the Woods, Little Misfortune and Agent A - a puzzle in disguise. It's a shame that all mysteries were not solved by the end of this game and it said "to be continued"

author: {'steamid': '76561198155589533', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 3614, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1604179611}
review:
Jenny LeClueâ€”Detectivu has the charm of a classic Humongous Entertainment game (Remember Spy Fox? Freddie Fish? Pajama Sam?) with a mature spin. Puzzles abound in this murder-mystery thriller that sets a sassy and snarly ginger junior genius up against a bizarre conspiracy. 

Thick with detective-story tropes and framed by the tale of an overwrought chapter-book author who simply wants to keep his protagonist's childhood sacred (despite the demands of the market and his publisher), Jenny LeClueâ€”Detectivu is a do-not-miss title, especially at Halloween.

EDIT: I appreciate the keyboard settings are customizable. I prefer using the arrow keys for primary movement over WASD and was able to reverse them without a problem while playing.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998656603', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 813, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 813, 'last_played': 1601651736}
review: It's a really nice game, very relaxing. Interesting story, great voice-over, enjoyable and simple gameplay. The big disappointment is the cliffhanger at the end... damn. Still, I recommend it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029328534', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 56, 'playtime_forever': 598, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1601230691}
review:
It's really charming and fun adventure game with good production values on voice acting and presentation. Bit worried about whether or not there is continuation to it since this is sort of "episode 1" but it definitely is long enough to be its own adventure game. Ending is cliffhanger though so again some people might want to wait there being sequel out first :p Depends on what is canon in sequel too since apparently this is "we decide second's game canon by what choices players picked in first one" sort of dealio, since some of things players can choice are much more interesting than other choices.

Sidenote, I'm really surprised at that I ended up liking the author framing device in the end. It did actually good job of making it easier to ignore things that in other stories might be broke the suspension of disbelief thing and it did give nice extra arc for the narrator too.

author: {'steamid': '76561197975057641', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 559, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 559, 'last_played': 1601183871}
review: Murder mystery adventure platformer. The graphics and voice acting are great. The main mystery _does_ get solved before introducing new mysteries for a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971442549', 'num_games_owned': 891, 'num_reviews': 186, 'playtime_forever': 648, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1601062448}
review:
As a puzzle game it's not particularly challenging. But the characters, style and story make it incredibly enjoyable.

+ Really beautiful graphic and very good voice acting!
+ Well-written and funny story and people, much deeper than you'd think.
+ Adorable animations and gorgeous backgrounds.
+ Interrogation and investigation are fun mechanics.
+ Surprisingly ... intense and serious at times.

- Some of the puzzles really feel like padding. They're not fun. just tedious.
- The walking around in some levels feels really, really slow.

It's a very nice experience and a lovely game in general. If they did a bit of editing on some of the puzzles it'd be almost perfect.

author: {'steamid': '76561199082934527', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 704, 'last_played': 1599345351}
review: WOAH this game was full of twists and turnsâ€“â€“and not the cliche ones that are often used in the mystery genre, either. The visuals are quite stunning, and I loved the cast of quirky characters. I was truly on the edge of my seat for the last few hours of this game, and I was incredibly impressed by how it all came together! Truly, bravo to the creators. My only complaints would be that some of the puzzles weren't particularly intuitive, and there were some parts in the middle that dragged on for a bit too long. But truly, I can't wait for the next game in the series!

author: {'steamid': '76561198072748946', 'num_games_owned': 337, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 643, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 643, 'last_played': 1597666364}
review:
A lovely little game that I was able to wind down with, in an evening.
With beautiful environments, great writing, and a cast of loveable characters, it brings back fond memories of early morning cartoons.
This is intended to be the first of two games, the sequel of which is yet to have a release date, so keep that in mind before buying.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999045915', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 102, 'playtime_forever': 591, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 591, 'last_played': 1597890575}
review:
Highly recommended for anyone looking for a fun, YA detective story. The animation is wonderful, the voice acting is great, the story is solid and memorable, and there was more content than I was expecting, plus incentive to replay.

It's not 100% perfect - there's some issues with pacing towards the end in which the explorable areas can become a bit of a slog, and the puzzle-y/logical deduction portions of the game become more scarce as you get to the second half of the game. And as a colorblind individual, I had some issues telling what was highlighted in the menus. Overall though, these are minor complaints on an extremely well polished and unique spin on the genre.

About 10 hours to beat a single runthrough, but this game exceeded my expectations on almost every front.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050570807', 'num_games_owned': 262, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 712, 'last_played': 1597115640}
review:
You should know that this installment ties up major plot points, but introduces new ones just before it becomes "To Be Continued". No real news on a sequel thus far, but the latest update at the time of this review bodes well for one.

If you want a detective adventure game done right, Jenny Leclue does almost everything right. The puzzles don't come with direct hints, but they're mostly logic puzzles and all of them dead simple. The story, writing, and voice acting are the main pull, so the straightforward puzzles get a pass.

I have one minor gripe with this game. Without getting spoilery, there is a character with a force of personality that feels, well, forced. Where there was potential for her to have had more depth than a cardboard cutout of a tired trope, it later turned out that she really did not. For a duration in the game I hoped to not see the worn-out scene where "Air Headed Companion almost gives away Main Character to Bad Guy for something that really could have waited until later, but does so anyway because they are so sweet/random". There was indeed such a scene in this game, presumably to some humourous effect, but I was so tired of it that it was lost on me. The same character does her "I'm in your way but only because I'm so sweet!" routine a little later, thankfully annoying for a grand total of two times only. Though cliches happen even in story-rich games like this, Jenny Leclue started off so strong that when it started to betray the creativity of its introduction, the disappointment was felt so, so much more so than if it were any other game.

Buy or no buy? Whether a sequel is incoming or not, the way Jenny Leclue does visuals, writing, and themes should be experienced by all fans of the point-and-click/adventure genre. Very worth 10/10 would buy again.

author: {'steamid': '76561198292087084', 'num_games_owned': 1757, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 934, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 934, 'last_played': 1596782234}
review:
As of August 2020, this game does not have an ending. You'll be playing up to a point where it gets very interesting and then... it stops. Roll credits. Literally, that's it. The story and game stops mid-way through with no questions answered at all.

I can't recommend this game at any price because it's incomplete, and certainly not at the $20 it sells for. It's a shame, too, since the graphics, music, story, and voice acting are all top notch. Those things exist to help bring the story alive in a visual novel game such as this. The story is what we're here for. I wouldn't want to read a novel that's half-written or watch a movie that's half-filmed. Likewise, I wouldn't want to play half a story-driven game. Yet that's what we have here.

I assume the developers ran out of money and just tossed it out for sale. Meanwhile, I feel cheated out of my money and will avoid this publisher in the future.

Buyer beware.

review: I bought this game without knowing what it really was.  I like how the narration of the author deconstructs the protagonist's perspective of the story and the overall plot.  Choices feel like they have an impact.  The puzzles are challenging but not impossible.  I just wish they had a normal mouse control option instead of the keyboard.

author: {'steamid': '76561198128083033', 'num_games_owned': 512, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1596123787}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a great game that I really loved playing.

The game's writing is top notch and its not surprising considering the game itself is told by a story writer that is the author of well liked Jenny LeClue series. The game we play is the most exciting entry of all time cause our writer has issues with his publishing company.

From a visual point, I really like this cartoonish style in games so I loved all aesthetics it offered. Beautiful is a great word to use to describe Jenny LeClue's art. 

The game reminded me Night in the Woods with both it's story and how it feels to play. This was a really positive thing because NITW was another game I really loved! 

I liked all characters game had but Suzie Glatz was my favorite! All the characters are really good written and feels great to meet every one of them. 

The only negative aspect of Jenny LeClue is that absurd cliffhanger ending. It had no explanation and purely was there to make a way for a second game. But, it didn't affect me that much. Only thing I thought was the fact I'm glad that I'm going to see Jenny once more in the future :D

Overall, I recommend this game to every point and click lovers and the story based game enthusiasts. With that said, I will go for chilling in the Jenny LeClue 2 waiting room.

author: {'steamid': '76561197978484533', 'num_games_owned': 1883, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 1049, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 597, 'last_played': 1595876081}
review:
This is a very hesitant recommendation.

First, the bad. There is a lot of walking in this game, and it's not particularly interesting walking. It's slow. Yes, there is a dedicated run button, but to create atmosphere it's disabled half the time. And sometimes it's not even walking, but climbing. Slow climbing across huge structures.
The game itself is a mix of puzzle types. The most common are search the scene for 'clues', but most of the time it's just scan over the whole thing to find the hot-spots. Then there are the mysteries, which are really just find odd ones out from a set of possibilities. And finally are the 'real' puzzles, which are all simple enough that you can just fiddle with them until they work without needing to actually think. So lots left to desire there. And on top of it all, you have a ton of false choices, that are often (but not always) transparent in how false they are.

But there is some good - the game is incredibly charming and the music throughout is wonderful. The charm pretty much makes up for the gameplay issues, and the music makes the long walking sections tolerable. The story is... captivating, but weird, and I'm not yet sure that it will all be acceptably wrapped up by the end.

And then the weird:
A glowing lake. A dead body. Mysterious circumstances. Old technologies dealing with the unique properties of this weird place. Secret passages. Finding clues by searching screens and interrogating suspects. Small side puzzles you need to solve to progress. An ultimately linear story. Great music, charming characters and good voice acting.
Am I describing Jenny LeClue or Tangle Tower?
(Though if you specifically want a game that has all those things, I'd hands down recommend Tangle Tower before this one.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198018495202', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 818, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 818, 'last_played': 1595707380}
review:
Parts of this I *really* liked.  The art is great.  Voice acting was added with an update (that happened to come out while I was in the midst of playing it), and it really adds to a cinematic feel to the game.  I found it funny and good natured.  The animation sequences for some of the deductions are really strong, and the journaling system is extensive in a way that allows you to flip back and appreciate the experiences.  The main mystery within the game also has a satisfying resolution, in terms of the reveal of the culprit and motive.  The game has a meta-element where Jenny LeClue is actually a fictional character and you have scenes with the author, and the tension between the protective author and Jenny provides for real fun (although it, like so many other of the game's big positives, is mostly in the first half and more muted toward the end).  

Two big downsides that are essentially fatal for recommending it: (1) The game really drags.  A lot of the puzzles are tedious, especially ones that involve a repeated mechanic (spinning dials, picking a lock).  A lot of it is also de-skilled platforming -- moving things so that you can climb and that sort of stuff.  As the game goes one, the tedious bits start to become more prominent, and the game spends a large part of the second half underground, which doesn't allow the art to shine; (2) There is a different mystery that also gets a lot of attention to the game, and indeed takes center stage for most of the second half before the denouement, and that one just ends totally abruptly, with a "To Be Continued." It was particularly annoying for me because the game has a choice at the end that seems EXTREMELY consequential and I really thought about it and only made the choice with some trepidation, and then it turned out not to matter at all except for something that happens in literally the last two seconds before "To Be Continued" shows up.  But, anyway, if the series does end up being continued, then maybe after the second game is finished the fact that it has this sort of cliffhanger will feel better, but as I write this I have no idea about what the odds of Jenny LeClue 2 coming into existence are, especially since the game was apparently a much-delayed Kickstarter.

Also, quirk of this game: How old is Jenny LeClue supposed to be?  It talks about how she is a "tiny" detective and her Mom talks about her a "just a child" and needing a babysitter and you get the sense of a lot of it being about a detective who is, I don't know, in junior high or so.   At the same time, though, the town in the game has a college, and it is implied that her sidekick friend is a benchwarming basketball player at the college and Jenny is presented as roughly the same age as some of the cheerleaders who are cheerleaders for the college.  Plus her friend has a father who is the college dean and is retirement age, which, sure, folks can father children well into old age, but it just created a lot of confusion about how I was supposed to approach some of the game's interactions.  Overall: 6/10 (but maybe 7/10 until its final minute).

author: {'steamid': '76561198002759061', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 671, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 671, 'last_played': 1592105868}
review:
I wanted to like this game. I enjoy the art and I love mysteries in general. It gave me the feel of old point and click adventures. 

BUT it's SO SLOW when it has no need to be. Both the plot and the gameplay. The puzzles aren't complicated and overall I became bored and dropped the game. I might recommend for a younger player, but otherwise save your time. Sadly I won't be getting mine back.

review:

La historia parece simple pero se va volviendo mÃ¡s compleja a medida de que avanza el juego.

Te exigen que, para publicar tu libro, la historia debe estar llena de misterio y asesinatos pero... Jenny LeClue se caracterizaba por resolver misterios "amigables" y aptos para niÃ±os, pero si quieres seguir con las publicaciones de tus libros debes acatar las Ã³rdenes... AsÃ­ es como Jenny se ve envuelta en la resoluciÃ³n de un crimen en Arthurton, la ciudad que parecÃ­a que lo tenÃ­a todo. 
Mientras resuelves el misterio de una muerte e intentas encontrar al verdadero asesino para sacar a tu madre de la carcel, pondrÃ¡s a prueba tu amistad con tu mejor amigo y tal vez puedas conocer nuevas amistades...

review: Had my eye on this game for a long time, and was excited to play when it came out. It surpassed my expectations with its charming town/characters and gorgeous art! This is definitely worth a purchase if you're into mysteries and fun stories. Really looking forward to the next installment, though I hope there are more side-cases next time around unrelated to the main story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053049087', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 778, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 773, 'last_played': 1593770539}
review:
Overall I enjoyed the game. Wonderful art style and atmosphere. Decent humor. HOWEVER,

as others have pointed out and I didn't know before hand,
the game currently doesn't seem to rap up all its plot threads and ends with a "To Be Continued" kind of thing.
I was not aware of this fact before hand and was left with a somewhat unsatisfied feeling after finishing my first playthrough.

I hope what happened to Broken Age doesn't happen with this game too.

On the flip side, it sounds like they'll be adding voice acting to the game soon, which I was also unaware of before playing.
So, that's nice. Maybe I'll replay the game some day. Hopefully it will have a conclusion by then.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971254143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 623, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 623, 'last_played': 1582103584}
review: Really enjoyed this game, I may be a little biased as someone who backed the kickstarter. Great for anyone who enjoys point and click adventure games with a lot of heart, similar to Night in the Woods. [spoiler] Wish more of the story got wrapped up, but am expecting to see more from them in the future, [/spoiler] I can't wait for more!

author: {'steamid': '76561198986138042', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 743, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 743, 'last_played': 1593713065}
review: I HOPE YOU MASE THE COUNTINUE FAST BC THIS GAME IS A BEST GAME I EVER PLAYED IN MY LIIIIIIFEEEEE

author: {'steamid': '76561197978604096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 469, 'last_played': 1593740736}
review:
If you like games like THIMBLEWEED PARK or OXENFREE or NIGHT IN THE WOODS, I think you're really going to enjoy this game. The artstyle is great, the music is wonderful, and I just really enjoy spending time with the characters. At time of review, I'm maybe half(?) way through the mystery and I'm hooked. 

If I had any minor quibble, the puzzles are mostly of the assembling puzzle pieces or rotating disc variety, but I think the style and breeziness of the puzzles keep it fresh. The game also has an interrogation, clue hunting, and deduction mechanic that is low key and fun. These are not hard puzzles and if you're expecting some Sierra-level moon logic (or Thimbleweed Park-level grammar sorcery), you might find them a little shallow, but I think they provide nice little diversions between story beats.

edit: Turns out I was farther into it than I thought! I guess this is going to be an episodic series? The ending is pretty abrupt and some people find it a little unsatisfying. For me, I reeeeaalllly loved the characters in this and I think it has a lot of heart, so I'm sad it's over but excited for Chapter 2: Detectivu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087395427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 676, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 676, 'last_played': 1593649683}
review:
Buyer beware: This game is episodic in nature. This is only Episode 1 (or at least that's the best explanation I've heard for why the ending is the way that it is).

This game is a very easy going, visually-appealing interactive story. The puzzles are very easy and the game is very forgiving. The art, animations, music, sound effects are all top notch.

If you're looking for a challenge, I'd recommend checking out an actually puzzle game, like The Witness or Baba is You. If you're looking for a good mystery game, this game is the one you want. 

The story is probably the weakest part of this game. The mystery's resolution feels a tad out of left field and the story is lackluster. The main character develops throughout the story, yes, but a lot of her character development doesn't feel earned IMHO. 

Would I recommend it? Yes. It is well-done overall. It will be especially worthwhile when the second part comes out.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202989419', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 148, 'playtime_forever': 1326, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 705, 'last_played': 1595889845}
review:
Update after voice acting added: Wow this game is just amazing now! With the added voice acting it puts this game over the top fantastic! The voice acting is so good and all of the characters match the voice perfectly!  I can't wait for the sequel!!

So this isn't the usual point and click game with inventory and puzzles that I typically play, but I'm really glad I gave it a try.  I wish there had been voice acting, but other than that this was a great game.  I'm looking forward to replaying and making a few different choices and finding all those stickers!  I really enjoyed the story though it started very sugary and beige, the story quickly changes and gets interesting and mysterious.  I'm eagerly awaiting the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198136237780', 'num_games_owned': 91, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1450, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 833, 'last_played': 1606550619}
review:
Graphics, story, character identities were cool. It's got no mechanics and I see this is one of those games to solve just puzzles. 
But, I think it could have been more sophisticated if it were some mechanics, (like there's no way I screw things up in gameplay).Lastly, [spoiler]Ending  is ridiculous to me, cause there were 3 options you may choose and each of them would have gotten you to the same door.If we will have the same ending, why would there be 3 options? It does not add up![/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198151395732', 'num_games_owned': 3946, 'num_reviews': 315, 'playtime_forever': 701, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1595369521}
review:
I first played the demo for this a few years ago on itch.io and was absolutely impressed. now that it's been kickstarted and fully released, I dipped my toes into it earlier today. and my first impressions are really positive:

+ the writing is fun and clever, the author is affable and Jenny is an adorable lead.
+ fantastic, unique visuals.
+ nice music.
+ so far, an interesting story conceit that has loads of potential.
+ solid puzzles.

by no means a definitive opinion, but things are looking good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198372126296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 669, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 669, 'last_played': 1593054114}
review: Great game - It was a little slow in the beginning but it does pick up so stick to it! Has excellent storytelling and visuals for the story. I was really absorbed in the game after a certain point which is a good sign to me. I would definitely play an additional installment when it is (hopefully) released :)

author: {'steamid': '76561198047761166', 'num_games_owned': 391, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 912, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 912, 'last_played': 1592976115}
review: This game has an incredible art style to it. The colors are brilliant and very pleasing to the eye. The atmosphere and musical choice also makes for a very pleasing experience. As far as the story goes I found it very fascinating! It wasn't too predictable the way other games tend to be and it had quite a few surprises that threw me off in the best way. I would definitely recommend trying this game out. It was longer than expected and worth the price.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060150011', 'num_games_owned': 603, 'num_reviews': 121, 'playtime_forever': 779, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 350, 'last_played': 1620927808}
review:
OK so I finally beat the game! Here is the edited review!

So this is a charming little adventure game about an author's character Jenny LeClue, a girl whose boring town suddenly becomes a LOT less boring after a murder happens and her mother is framed! Jenny must use her detective skills to find out just what's going on and save her mom - and the author's - reputation.

That's the premise to a captivating story full of well written characters, there's a fair bit of humor in there and even some scary stuff, but nothing that isn't too outside the realm of family friendly. The dialogue between characters is believable and snappy! The ending as mentioned in the product page is a cliffhanger ending and while some people took umbrage with it I personally felt it fit right in and worked wonderfully as a cliffhanger! My advice to anyone playing this is make sure to pay attention to BOTH sides of the story, and things will fit together nicely.

Such a great story would be lost on the player however if it wasn't presented well, and Mografi have knocked the presentation out of the park and into the stratosphere! This game is GORGEOUS, absolutely beautiful environments, personality-filled character animations, cinematic camera work, it's almost an interactive cartoon! The music and sound design are equally as great and really help with the immersion. Plus voice acting will be coming soon so it's going to get even better!

The gameplay is not a point and click as you might believe but rather controller/keyboard only and I would definitely recommend a controller after playing with the keyboard. There is basic side-scrolling platforming which occasionally breaks into separate scenes where you search for clues with a magnifying glass or interact with an object in some way. This gameplay and also the puzzles are not the most challenging but that doesn't matter to me, not every game has to be crazy-intense on the reflexes or Sierra absurdly complicated puzzles. I had definite fun playing this and I think you will too. There's a cool system where you can see how dialogue choices represent the type of player you are, and some of these choices will affect the development of the next game! ALSO YOU CAN DECORATE YOUR JOURNAL WITH STICKERS!!!

There are the occasional bugs where the game gets stuck and you can't get out but they are working diligently to iron them out and the auto-save is so generous you'll never lose much progress if you happen to run into one.

Bottom line, this is a game made from the heart and you won't be disappointed. It took a few years to come out but it's SO WORTH IT!  Can't wait for Jenny LeClue, Detectivu 2!

Excellent work, Mografi!

author: {'steamid': '76561197999317451', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1000, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1000, 'last_played': 1591717540}
review:
There are many qualities to this game, but one minor, one major and one gigantic flaws. 

Pros:

* I never expected such a high quality for the art and animation from a very small indie team. Even where repeated, art is always stylish, charming and never boring. 
* The story is well written (if only a bit slow to really start) and a decent length in my opinion. 
* The puzzles are nice even though I found them slightly too easy, but that blends well with the "charming" tone of the game in my opinion. 

Cons:

* The minor flaw is that many mini games (I cannot really call those puzzles... it's just pressing a button repeatedly) are boring. 
* The major flaw is that there is no mouse support on PC. This was clearly designed with consoles in mind but it is still baffling it is not there for PC.
* The gigantic flaw is that this not a full game even though it is marketed/I bought (kickstarted) it as such. Ending a game in the middle of the story you have worked the whole game to build with a "to be continued" message is really lame. Honestly, if the story was finished properly, I would have bought a second instalment without a second thought but with this situation, I really feel ripped of. So my advice to anybody who did not buy this game yet, is to avoid buying it until the second part is released and this half game is marketed as such.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009752238', 'num_games_owned': 953, 'num_reviews': 211, 'playtime_forever': 718, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 718, 'last_played': 1591597150}
review:
This was a very charming and unique game and I'm super happy I played it. I want to say that Jenny Leclue plays like a Point and Click game, except that it;s side scrolling. It took me some getting used to at first, but I liked how unique the developers made it.

The story comes at you in two-fold. On the meta side of things you are an author who has been writing a popular child detective series for years. However, your agent says that you need to spice it up or bit or your series will be cancelled. That's right, someone in the series has to DIE in your next book! The second fold is you playing as Jenny, the child detective who lives in the small town of Arthurton. It's one of those perfect small towns that no one really knows, but tourists love to pass through when traveling. It's a pretty boring town, however, it has some surprising secrets. Jenny somehow gets pulled in to the mystery of the town and has to find out what its hiding!

The controls are pretty simple. I used a controller and you will mostly be moving left to right and investigating various objects and things to solve small cases. The dialogue was very funny and well written. I love how the author is the narrator and would argue with Jenny sometimes. The way you solve cases was very fun. After gathering clues, the game does a fun thing where you have to match the corresponding clues to solve the case.

The art style is very cute and stylish. Love the colors and the hand writing scribbles whenever Jenny is investigating things. The puzzles are decently challenging as well. Some made me scratch my head and I had to think. But they were never so hard that I needed a guide or anything. Although there is no voice acting, the music is nice and ambient for all the mystery and danger Jenny will find herself in. You will also find yourself making choices that will alter the story slightly and there are multiple endings as well. The game oozes charm and I love it.

I only have one gripe with this game. There are a lot of platforming puzzles and they aren't much of a problem. Some of them will have you pushing and pulling objects to reach higher ledges. They mapped the push and climb button to the same button and often times I would have trouble getting Jenny to do one or the other in certain puzzles because of this. I feel they should have made the pushing a diffferent button and the climbing another to prevent the super minor frustration. It's a small gripe, but you'll understand once you reach those puzzles.

Final verdict? Give it a try! It's a great game, only about 9-10 hours long and very fun! It's fun trying to solve the mystery along with Jenny and figure out who gets killed. I got a very cliffhanger ending that didn't make sense, but I think that's just because I got a bad ending. I still loved this game and hope they continue the series. Thanks for reading!

TL:DR: A point and click-like adventure game that is side scrolling. Very charming and fun with decent challenging puzzles. I recommend it if you want to play a fun and cute mystery game with as a child detective!

author: {'steamid': '76561198027879009', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 785, 'last_played': 1593881330}
review:
I found this gem by accident. What a surprise! I did not expect to see such a charming game with a story that captures the mystery of exploring something unknown so well. 

A good mixture of humor, riddles, exploration, danger. The riddles are logical and can be solved by observation. The exploration is lengthy enaugh to provide a sense of greatness without being tedious. The choices that you have to make increase the immersion quite a bit. Let the mystery unfold!

I would really love to see more of this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045487131', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 586, 'last_played': 1591322271}
review: My husband and I played Jenny LeClue without looking up too much about it. Quirky smart main character- check. Good writing- check. Fun mysteries to solve-check. However, some of the ways to go about things is clunky and not user intuitive. I wish there was more mouse support. We really enjoyed playing the game but were really disappointed to be hit with the fact that it is episodic at the end of the game. Thinking that maybe I missed it on the store page I went back to pour over it. The store does say it's episodic, but you have to click the read more under a ton of information about the game (I really didn't want to know much before going in to deepen the mystery). I believe that the developers should have put that in the top or the synopsis paragraph to the side. I really wouldn't have minded it being episodic if I was mentally prepared for it. I'm still recommending the game because I really did enjoy it, but with the warning that IT IS EPISODIC.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163977244', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 821, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 821, 'last_played': 1589682506}
review:
I really don't know what to think of this game. It's sort of... childish, and sweet, and family-friendly on one hand, but some sequences, my god. They are just creepy.

Lovely art style, beautiful and vibrant, entertaining story, good puzzles, the game brought some chuckles, even if behind all the blush it tells a painfully familiar story of the murder of someone's creativity. I generally liked it, it had nice pacing, things, however weird they were, made sense, and I left with a hope of a sequel for this game, but such things as harder puzzles and mouse support (and yes, I realsie it's a tablet port) would only make it better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019934920', 'num_games_owned': 633, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 567, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 567, 'last_played': 1589737212}
review:
Jenny ist ein kleines MÃ¤dchen in der langweiligen Stadt Arthurton. Ihr groÃŸer Traum ist es Detektivin zu sein und ein groÃŸes Mysterium aufzuklÃ¤ren. Ihr Traum geht jedoch schneller in ErfÃ¼llung als erwartet und sie stÃ¼rzt Hals Ã¼ber Kopf in einer unglaubliche VerschwÃ¶rung hinein.
Das Spiel prÃ¤sentiert sich in einem wunderschÃ¶nen Cartoon-Stil und sprÃ¼ht mit den verrÃ¼ckten und interessanten Charakteren nur so vor Charme und Witz und auch die Musik trÃ¤gt sehr gut zum Erlebnis bei. Durch das "WÃ¤hlerischkeit"-System hat man die MÃ¶glichkeiten durch Entscheidungen die Story zu beeinflussen, wobei das jedoch anscheinand nicht allzu groÃŸe Auswirkungen auf den Ausgang der Geschichte hat. Alles in allem ist es ein sehr schÃ¶nes und verspieltes Detektivabenteuer, bei dem selten etwas so ist, wie man es erwartet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198077831915', 'num_games_owned': 450, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1301, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1301, 'last_played': 1589487696}
review:
I first learned about Jenny LeClue a few years ago through Adventuregamers, after it had already been funded on Kickstarter. I followed the progression of the game through the developer's page and eagerly awaited the arrival of this beautifully animated detective game, led by a young girl no less! 
I regret to say that even though the developers obviously put a lot of effort in this game, itâ€™s poorly constructed in terms of gameplay, plot and pace. After spending 21 hours of my life on it, which Iâ€™m never getting back, I feel a bit outraged â€“ so forgive my long review and negative rant. I really regret being a completionist since I otherwise would have deserted the game maybe an hour after trying it.
The thing that bothers me most is that even though the protagonist is a child, I didnâ€™t expect the game to be aimed at kids and did not see any indication in the description or marketing that this was the case. But the pace and gameplay scream â€œslowed for kids to followâ€, with repetitive and easy mechanics. I was expecting a cool, funny and challenging point and click adventure game, and got a visual novel with some low-challenge platforming and a frustratingly slow pace. Speaking of miscommunicating what the game is â€“ nowhere is it mentioned that the game has countless boring and unchallenging platformer sequences.
I want to focus on the clunky and annoying mechanics â€“ instead of clicking on items to make them work, the game forces you to tap repeatedly each time. Whatâ€™s wrong with a simple point and click? Why do you have to make the players work hard to do something simple? The dialogues force you to press the enter button after each short sentence or description, and thereâ€™s a lot of them. Sometimes a magnifying glass appears and you have to search the screen for something hidden and hold till you see what it is. Every gameplay mechanic is repetitive and annoying â€“ you find stickers for your journal (not interesting if youâ€™re above a certain age), you have the simplest â€œput together parts of postcardsâ€, you have to make electrical circuits work with the right flow. The only original puzzles in the game are syncing radio waves together to get messages, and deciphering messages from a book with a certain code. Though the puzzles are simple and not creative in general, the real sin is how much they recur; after the third identical puzzle solution (breaking a barrier by tapping 30 times in different places, for instance, which I had to do at least 5 times) â€“ itâ€™s not fun.
It takes the game forever to move past the introduction and actually get to the main mystery, and even after the long unveiling weâ€™re left with a bunch of tired tropes (evil corporation! Cover-up! Things not as they seem! What is ridiculed at first is actually true!). To make matters worse, a lot of things are left unexplained and unaddressed, and the game ends with a cliffhanger! Yes, you get the infamous â€œto be continuedâ€ at the end after only part of the issues were resolved. A very long game just to get to a half-resolution so the developers can compel you to buy their next game? Not cool. Also, the frame story in which an author of detective stories struggles with his editorâ€™s demand to make Jennyâ€™s world more gruesome and murderous adds very little to the plot, is a tired trope, and makes the game longer with little value in return.
The music, like the gameplay, is repetitive and gets old very fast, and there is no voice acting that might have brought some flair to otherwise-stereotypical characters.
The art is really the one aspect that makes the game shine, and I really wish that the rest of the game had aligned with that.

review:
This has the look and feel of being more a kids game than something designed for adults or people looking for entertainment, thus be forewarned.
The pacing of the game has all the charm of an Alcoholics Anonymous meeting without coffee and donuts. I consider my purchase of this game to be more of a donation to the developers than anything else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017019225', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1723, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 373, 'last_played': 1589201668}
review:
Good amount of actual thinking needed for a relaxing game. Bright and colourful, an art style that reminds me of the old Hanna Barbera animations with their Bristol paper backgrounds. Beautiful scene transistions and good variety in the ways of interaction.

One thing that could be improved is remapping the trigger buttons to progress the dialogue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198087943883', 'num_games_owned': 768, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 499, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 499, 'last_played': 1589029924}

author: {'steamid': '76561198144434789', 'num_games_owned': 261, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 218, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 218, 'last_played': 1588957789}
review:
ComeÃ§o extremamente interessante e cativante, com visuais absolutamente lindos e chamativos. O jogo comeÃ§a com uma introduÃ§Ã£o (FTUE) muito gostosa que conduz e insere o jogador na temÃ¡tica muito eficazmente. 

Entretanto, da mesma maneira que nÃ³s somos inseridos, nÃ³s somos retirados, pois, com o passar do tempo, o jogo se torna repetitivo e monÃ³tono, com mecÃ¢nicas, Ã  primeira vista, interessantes, mas que ao serem utilizadas repetidas vezes, tornam-se massantes. 

Ainda no Ã¢mbito do game design, o jogo nÃ£o tem um bom flow, pois ele nÃ£o concede respiros e nos faz permanecer em uma incessantemente subida frustrante de puzzles cansativos com uma narrativa medÃ­ocre.

Resumindo, Ã© um jogo muito competente em ser visualmente lindo, mas que, talvez infelizmente, nos gera tanta expectativa por ter um comeÃ§o tÃ£o cativante, que, depois de algumas horas jogando, ficamos desamparados ao percebermos que o jogo se resumirÃ¡ a somente isso.

Apesar de tudo, Ã© preciso ressaltar, mais uma vez, como o jogo Ã© absolutamente lindo. Fiquei apaixonado com a beleza grÃ¡fica, ela me impactou e me fez gostar, ainda mais, do comeÃ§o do jogo. AlÃ©m disso, o product value Ã© outro fator a ser comentado: Ã© estonteante o carinho que os desenvolvedores tiveram em colocar inÃºmeros detalhes grÃ¡ficos, e, tambÃ©m, feedbacks que, apesar de parecerem imperceptÃ­veis, fazem toda diferenÃ§a! 

Eu realmente queria passar mais tempo naquele inÃ­cio ensolarado, saindo da universidade, vendo os pÃ¡ssaros e conversando com o reitor, talvez resolvendo alguns casos por ali mesmo, queria ter aproveitado mais do jogo e, sinceramente, gostaria de ter sido cativado do inÃ­cio ao fim. Infelizmente nÃ£o aconteceu.

Talvez eu esteja sendo tÃ£o duro, pois eles me botaram tÃ£o lÃ¡ no alto que a queda foi brusca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210864601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 856, 'last_played': 1599910746}
review:
To be continued, but not unfinished.
After I'd bought the game I read a review (yeah I know, wrong order) that complained that the game just stops with a 'to be continued'. While this is true, there is a resolution of sorts and it really doesn't matter that much. The 'ASDW' interface is kind of old school and even after playing for hours I was still hitting the arrow keys and wondering why nothing moved but that's probably just me.
The crucial thing in any adventure game (iIMHO) is that the story drives the gameplay and that's true here. I rarely had to think about what I was supposed to be doing.  All in all a fun, distinctive and quirky game. I'm looking forward to part two!

author: {'steamid': '76561197981325554', 'num_games_owned': 325, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 220, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 220, 'last_played': 1569023276}
review:
It's more of a visual novel, not a game.

I purchased Jelly LeClue when it was still in production, based on the eye candy looks and some humour from the trailer. 
And it really does look amazing. The story is also quite ok.

However, there is not enough "gameplay" for me to even consider calling it a game. It's really a visual novel. Just because you can move character between places and click on some things to have a puzzle or two (they are also quite repetitive here) doesn't mean it has any gameplay.

Jenny LeClue feels boring. It drags a lot. Usual visual novels have mostly unanimated screens with a lot of text and dialogue choices. Here you have empty spaces you can walk on, with some little dialogue going on between them. The game also likes to lock you up in one room until you "solve" (find/click) something. Then it moves you to another room. It's very linear in this regard. 

The whole things seems like its main target was kids. This was never specified in the descriptions and I found the whole experience was a bit "tacky" in this regard. 

The game is also unfinished. It ends with a "to be continued" sign. So... clearly the creator couldn't manage to finish it in time, maybe due to the poor design choices - if there's no gameplay and all you have is some dialog and a LOT of graphics, then drawing all this by hand (and animating!) can really take forever. 

All in all it's not a good game, if it even is a game. However, if you're looking for something for your young kids to play, then it may be ok. But reading a book is probably better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198157388471', 'num_games_owned': 158, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 694, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 694, 'last_played': 1587346068}
review:
Para los que sepan hablar espaÃ±ol o enterderlo.

Disfrute mucho el juego, me gusto la forma en como se mostraba tanto en la historia, como en su arte visual el juego; tanto en el aspecto de cada personaje que le da un tono unico de todos los demas, y el mundo en donde se desarrolla la historia; los personajes son muy carismaticos y cada uno tiene su propia historia si pones atencion. Recomiendo si te alcanza el dinero y te interesa la premisa del juego, vale la pena darle una oportunidad; o si no, puedes ir a ver unos youtubers para ver la historia (de aqui en adelante ya es tu decision si quieres comprarlo o verlo en youtube).

y spoilers de aqui en adelante.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
Aunque el juego haya quedado en un final inconcluso, y por lo que la mayoria opine sobre que este tipo de premisas pueda ser un poco fustrantes en varios elementos como las series para una segunda temporada para continuar la historia; o como las veces que en la saga de "The walking dead" de TellTales (que en paz descanse) que la historia continue en el siguiente capitulo. Pero en mi opinion, si podemos sobrevivir a esta pandemia que estamos ahora, espero con ancias la siguiente entrega de esta saga, para ver como concluye o como fluye la historia en la segunda parte. (y tal vez pude haber puesto todo esto es ingles; idioma que la mayoria habla, pero me da flojera ( :P ) )

review: SPOILER ALERT! IT ENDS ON A HUUUUUGE CLIFFHANDER! FUCK!!!! WHY!? Who the hell makes a Detective/Mystery story and ends it on a CLIFFHANDER!?!? Mystery stories are ALL about the catharsis at the very end! The Denouement! The Big Reveal!! THE FUCK!? I loved this game so much that it just sucks all the more that there is a nonending and that I have to not recommend it.... UGH! Please get the damn sequel out soon so I can find out what the hell actually happens in this story!!!

author: {'steamid': '76561198011515841', 'num_games_owned': 739, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 2800, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1026, 'last_played': 1639443471}
review:
Absolutely loved this game!  It was what I expected, a girl detective story, but it was much more.  The detective story is framed by that of the author who is pressured to make Jennyâ€™s stories more exciting.  And so an exciting story we get.  The wonderful range of characters and the story are the best part of this game.  Coming in a close second is the beautiful and colorful artwork that makes up the town of Arthurton both above and below the surface.

Some of the puzzles were repetitive, but they make sense with the story and this game is too good for that to be a deal breaker.  The challenge level was very doable.  No walkthroughs needed but enough of a challenge that I wasnâ€™t bored.

There are collectibles and optional areas that give more information and fill out the story even more.  I would recommend spending the time and not rushing through.  My play time was about 16 hours to complete the game, find all the secret areas and almost all the collectibles.  Even if you speed through, you should get at least 8-10 hrs of play time.

The developers have said that voiceovers have been recorded and will be added in an update soon.  There is discussion over the game ending on a cliffhanger.  The entire mystery of Arthurton and Jenny LeClueâ€™s family will be continued into the sequel.  The main case that was the crux of this game was solved. The game leaves you wanting more because there is more to discover about whatâ€™s going on in this place, but I completely disagree that the game is â€œunfinished.â€  The Case of Who Killed the Dean is solved.  The developers gave an update last month saying the sequel is in pre-production right now and I canâ€™t wait for it!

This game was cute, funny and sucked me in from start to finish.  I highly recommend this game.  It is well worth the price and the time to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198398256896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 805, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 805, 'last_played': 1585693755}
review:
I appreciate this game more after largely coming up empty when looking for similar games to Night in the Woods. If you like that game, you should definitely give this one a try, there are lots of similar elements both narratively and stylistically.

However, be warned that the ending very abruptly announces that this game is only part 1 of a larger story, in a way that didn't feel earned.

author: {'steamid': '76561198909219065', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 418, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 418, 'last_played': 1580643274}
review: I really love a lot of things about this game. I've been looking for a point and click game for awhile and this one suits my needs really well. From the relaxing soundtrack to gameplay that doesn't make the user think TOO hard, I really enjoy that the game lets you enjoy the story while also having fun. The graphics are really cute and the writing is just amazing. I hope to see more games like this from the developers soon :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198165791247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 112, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 112, 'last_played': 1580446435}
review:
beautiful visuals, music, animation, and i think the dialog is good. sadly, however, this game does not suit my tastes. it has everything i love about a good game, except the gameplay isn't my thing. i'm fine with puzzles, just not these ones. it's a game that requires patience, of course, but it's asking too much of it from me and i don't find the puzzles to be very amusing (in my opinion).

it's definitely a great game, and i think it's worth the money if you have the patience to play through it. personally, it's just not for me. i'd say give it try and see if you might enjoy it.

also, this is technically part 1. from what i've read, the story ends on a cliffhanger.

8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198047897265', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 609, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 609, 'last_played': 1579984221}
review: Great graphics, potentially interesting plot, but so painfully slow and unchallenging that it sucks the fun right out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993516952', 'num_games_owned': 904, 'num_reviews': 277, 'playtime_forever': 693, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 693, 'last_played': 1579928080}
review:
Jenny LeClue is a promising adventure game from a fledgling studio. On the whole, I think the game shines brightest aesthetically: the art, music, and animation are very well done. The writing and character work is also handled well. My biggest issue comes with the gameplay: instead of playing like a LucasArts point-and-click adventure, it's a sidescroller with very limited interactivity. It feels like playing a point-and-click adventure game with the hint system forced on. Making matters worse, traversal is typically boring: slowly climbing vines or ladders, the lockpicking minigame doesn't add anything, nor does the breaking of the planks do a satisfying job of creating pleasruable pacing. The game is at its best when it tells its story and lets you converse with the denizens of the town. It has a great sense of humor, and there's real character development going on here. I would really like to see a sequel embrace the more old school tenents of classic adventure games, namely actual puzzles without holding your hand. Perhaps a combination of the two styles could work. Keep the 2d movement but maybe include a full fledged inventory and allow us to solve puzzles. I would much rather prefer that than slowly climb up more ladders or vines.

In sum, not without its flaws to be sure, this is an adventure game with a lot of heart and charm. I look forward to the follow-up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198432100968', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1612, 'last_played': 1579676093}
review: I expected this game to be point & click like the demo. It isn't. So I couldn't play until I could get help with the parts that required jumping, climbing, & grabbing. Which is practically the entire game. After 26 hours of game play it did not save my game like it is supposed to automatically do. I've closed and opened this game a million times before and it had always saved it right where I left off. I was so close to the end of the game! My only option now is to start a new game. I have no desire or physical energy to start this game all over again. The cost of this game was way overpriced for the agony it has brought me.  If I could I would ask for a refund!

author: {'steamid': '76561198123274967', 'num_games_owned': 483, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 549, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1578953721}
review: It's a pity that I can't recommend Jenny LeClue, because I did have a good time playing it. The mystery is intriguing, the writing is great, the art is lovely. The music fits well but does get a bit repetitive. The main issue is the gameplay - for a game with such cool stuff to think about, it doesn't really ask the player to think at any point. A couple of the detective sections use a nice system where you have to decide the three most important bits of information. This is a nice device but is used too seldom and never really develops. Instead, the game repeats other bits of gameplay such as a boating section which just aren't fun. A lot of the gameplay, such as the boating section, are "things you do" rather than proper gameplay, which is a pity. If you can look past that and just want to have a nice time with a charming story and fun characters, then pick this game up. As a whole package though, I think it falls sadly short.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970653174', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 238, 'playtime_forever': 3260, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 605, 'last_played': 1618561236}
review:
It's a highly story-driven, puzzle-ish, enheartening story.

Pros:
* Decent character development - often obvious, but it happens, which gives it a leg up on its competition.
* Good level design.
* Puzzles were fun but not difficult enough to distract from the plot.
* Choices have an effect (?) - seems like it's the case, anyway.
* Collectibles weren't hard to find, if you search nooks and crannies.  I probably missed some, but it felt like I found most w/o seriously searching.

Cons:
* Ending was... sharp, and unsatisfying.  (Very strong hints of [spoiler]continuing the story in a sequel[/spoiler])

TL;DR: 8/10 if you ignore the ending, else 6/10 - Good, and probably worth replaying again after a few months pass, to clear my mind.  Vastly lower score because the ending really, really irked me.

author: {'steamid': '76561198439109183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 752, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 752, 'last_played': 1578853739}
review: For the 1980's Sierra fan. This was a great choice. The puzzles in Jenny LeClue weren't hard but also not too easy. The story was engaging with a nice touch of snarky humor. Characters we likable for the most part. A couple of them bugged me, but that's to be expected. The perspective of having an author writing the novel as you play was equally entertaining. That ending though...

author: {'steamid': '76561198259860019', 'num_games_owned': 90, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 267, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 266, 'last_played': 1580703436}
review: Over all great game, The story line is great. As is the art style, with the almost always blue undertones, I like the color blue. The gameplay itself might be improved a some bit. Sometimes I get stuck with what I see, however Jenny can still move and I would guess interact with things but I can see it happen, so would have to go to the quit and start the game up again. But that is only one point off a 9/10 game. Ohh and don't stop playing because you think the 1st 30min of the game is easy or childish, because it quickly speeds up.
