author: {'steamid': '76561197970318758', 'num_games_owned': 713, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 877, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 877, 'last_played': 1571360426}
review: I waited a long time for this to game to finally get completed and released and happily I can say I really enjoyed it. While not particularly challenging, the story, characters and writing was entertaining and the art is/was oh so beautiful. Played a good chunk of it with my 9-yo daughter who was quite engaged and wouldn't let me continue on without her.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042664827', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 730, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 730, 'last_played': 1577842217}
review: Good not great little linear adventure. The music and art style are quite nice, and the gameplay elements and locations have some variety even if they have little meaning or real choice. Fun enough story. Puzzles pretty easy but not completely brainless. All in all a decent time.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971202050', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 210, 'playtime_forever': 1517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 663, 'last_played': 1579446140}
review:
How an adventure game should be.
No myst difficulty crap puzzles.
Just exciting exploring, finding stuff, solving nice little puzzles.
Wonderfull story with fun characters.
Beautifull game !

author: {'steamid': '76561198011639423', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1435, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1321, 'last_played': 1598730978}
review:
I haven't played a lot of adventure games this  decade, but of the ones I have, Shardlight, Thimbleweed Park and Broken Age, Jenny LeClue is the one I think I'll replay a lot. While I didn't love the design interface, the WASD keys will be the death of me and the meta elements that took me out of the game, I loved how Jenny used deductions, the magnifying glass element and the world building was just sublime. I just wanted to explore more of Arthurton, especially Skull Island. I enjoyed the characters and while I'm very intrigued by the ending or endings, I wish it didn't end up on a cliffhanger.

P.S. full voice would be great but I understand if it wasn't in the budget.

author: {'steamid': '76561198280468840', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1837, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1029, 'last_played': 1576788998}
review:
Playing through this, was an experience like no other. The story is complex, delivering a heart stopping adventure. You can choose multiple choices that affect the grand scheme of the story tremendously! It only took me two nights to finish this game for the first time through. But I foresee several more days of playing to uncover more of the mysteries. I will warn you of a cliff hanger ending that MAY haunt your dreams until a sequel is made. But all in the same, this game is VERY WELL WORTH THE PRICE. 
 Jenny LeClue, became a character I related to and some of the choices ended up being heart breaking. Though one choice made things seem as if choices were going to lead to the same climax, it changed dramatically. There are big twists in this story and, even the slightest mistakes can seem much larger. I, myself wound up blaming myself for not turning the boilers off. Yet at the end it didn't show if they caused the ending I was suspecting would happen. In fact, the ending, or shall I say the cliff hanger leaves players wondering what choices will carry over. What the switch meant at the end, sorry for spoilers. I simply can't wait to play and read the sequel to find out what happens next.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079220438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 1637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1637, 'last_played': 1575783518}
review:
This game had an amazing plot. It was a good mystery with twists that kept me guessing. The characters were charming and felt like they had deep back stories. I can't wait until the next chapter for Jenny!

I liked that we had choices to make Jenny snarky or nice. Some choices have consequences on the plot points later and where you can explore. There's a setting to turn off the choice timer if you have trouble making the right (or less wrong!) decision.

Great mechanics for making it replayable. Jenny finds stickers and postcard fragments in spots where you may not think to explore. The stickers were so cute I wanted to find them all!

I can see some similarities from some of my favorite games. A notebook to collect notes like in Night in the Woods, but also to collect clues to the mystery. A radio frequency puzzle like Oxenfreee, but the radio puzzle was a little more complex. The bridge scene really reminded me of the spooky landscapes in Oxenfree. One song in the sound track really reminded me of the Machinarium sound track. Oh, and one sound track used a Mega Marvin, which is always neat and creepy to hear.

There's new mechanics in this game as well. Introducing an author as the narrator of the game means we get to pick when the author can't make a decision as to what to write. I loved some of the visual representations of this being a story someone was writing. [spoiler] It was amazing seeing Jenny run past the words the author was typing. [/spoiler] 

I would definitely replay this, and I'm looking forward to the sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198307903631', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 923, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1576001186}
review:
I have to say that the localization needs improvement. I have wishlisted the game for years and purchased it right after the release. But I had great difficulty in starting the new game in Chinese. I thought there was some bug and was waiting for fixes. Until today, I found that it was only because on the menu of "start new game? cancel / confirm", the button of "confirm" is missing in the Chinese version, so Chinese players have no way to know how to start the game! (unless they selected the confirm button that cannot be seen accidentally.) I hope this can be fixed soon so more Chinese players can enjoy this game, which, I expect to be great.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035930579', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 622, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 490, 'last_played': 1615166131}
review:
I held off on getting this for a little while, then picked it up during the Autumn Sale. My word, I'm glad I did! The art is beautiful, the story is riveting, and the MUSIC! I can't say enough about the sound design in this game! It's phenomenal! 

I really enjoyed the progression of the story, it went from everyday normal to absolutely insane in a very gradual manner until you were down a rabbit hole and not entirely sure how you got there. I also loved the "outside" story with the author, it really added another layer to the whole game. 

There are a few cons to this game tho. I ran into a bug in the sewers where Jenny was behind the scenery she was supposed to be running in front of, but it didn't stop me from interacting with anything, and a cutscene fixed it. The game also ends in a to be continued. Which, I hope it does, but this might be the only piece of the game we get. I think it's worth it, but you might not. Also, while I haven't gone through and unlocked all of the achievements for this game yet, I have the suspicion that this game only has one ending. So, if you were one of the people who was protesting outside of Bioware at the way Mass Effect ended, you won't like this game. 

TLDR: Awesome story, amazing music, totally worth the money.

author: {'steamid': '76561197977164553', 'num_games_owned': 1825, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 633, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 633, 'last_played': 1573164876}
review:
This game is quite intriguing. The art style is interesting. Somewhat reminiscient of South Park but a bit more grainy. The ideas are well implemented. I enjoyed my time with the game a lot.
There were only a few nagging issues, which did not detract too much from the overall enjoyment of the game.
The main character is a bit on the annoying side. The story stops abruptly on a cliffhanger. The puzzles were a bit on the easy side. The achievements are rather cryptic especially given the lack of description for many of them.
As stated above I enjoyed the game. The asking price is fine. 
I had a somewhat difficult time to come to a decision on the topic of recommending this game. But it fell ultimately on the recommended side.
Score: 7/9 - A good game with a few hiccups.

author: {'steamid': '76561197992572112', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 577, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 318, 'last_played': 1574575083}
review:
This game is charming and visually beautiful. This little mountain town has stunning vistas! The framing device is an author trying to revive a dying series about a girl detective, and most of the game is you playing through the book as he writes it. It's not especially difficult, but the story really keeps you interested because the author is wrestling with how dark to make the plot, so it's not all rainbows and lost puppies. Nor is Jenny a Mary Sue; she's often a jerk.

Runs smoothly, is respectful of your time, has lots of fun things to find but not so much it stresses me out, but is sometimes a little buggy. I've had to reset the game a few times, but I never lost more than like three minutes of progress.

author: {'steamid': '76561198158196956', 'num_games_owned': 3737, 'num_reviews': 189, 'playtime_forever': 2434, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1007, 'last_played': 1655245705}
review:
[url=http://store.steampowered.com/curator/32296668-Casual-Game-Reviews/]More reviews on our Curator Page[/url]

[b]Jenny LeClue - Detectivu[/b] is the result of a very promising and successful [url=https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/mografi/jenny-leclue-a-handmade-adventure-game]crowdfunding project[/url], one that hasnâ€™t finished yet. The current goal aims to produce the second and third episode, in order to finally release the complete game and even aim at console port.

As you guessed by now the current game is in fact the first episode. This alone doesnâ€™t state much since itâ€™s a 10 hour game, therefore calling it episodic may not be appropriate, however, before you continue, please notice the game is â€œTo be continuedâ€. The final ends in a total cliffhanger, one I canâ€™t want to continue!

[b]Jenny LeClue - Detectivu[/b] is a fantastic game and for mystery fans, itâ€™s a game which one cannot miss. The storyline is simple but well worked to a point where it becomes better with each hour that passes. Without many spoilers, itâ€™s one of those stories that youâ€™ll never guess what they are until you dive into the game. Thereâ€™s thrill, mystery, crime, conspiracy theories, and itâ€™s all perfectly mixed.

The narrative and dialogues are charming and developed extremely well, making the game addictive like a book, even for those who do not enjoy reading. Interactions between Jenny and the narrator are amazing and completely add a new contemplation to the whole game. The humour between the lines, the twists and the improbable, but charismatic events will make you laugh and feel touched at the same time.

The mystery takes on the gameplay with substance, almost like an extension of curiosity itself. Players control Jenny in a 2D environment, like a in a cartoon where scenarios and characters are made with paper. Interacting with objects and solving puzzles almost seems identical to a Point & Click, but when played, it feels unique and not something that emulates other games in a different way.

I personally suppose it works well for mobile and will seemingly work fantastic on consoles. The puzzles are simple, nothing fancy or over complicated. The whole point of entertaining is not through harsh puzzles, but instead, relying on their creation and genuity. Eventually puzzles or mini-games become repetitive such as connecting wired dots or putting together scraps of paper like a jigsaw puzzle. In the end they work well and are fun to complete, without making you feel exhausted.

The most fantastic, unique and pleasant mechanic of the game is clearly the Investigations where young Jenny observes a scene and analyse the clues. Although they are scripted and part of the story, players will analyze evidence, people and objects by moving freely and spotting areas of interest. When all clues are gathered itâ€™s also up to you to place evidences together in order to find answers. This mechanic is awesome and super fun.

Visually [b]Jenny LeClue[/b] is a hand-made wander, with beautiful colors and perfect atonement of vibrant and deep pigmentation contrasts. From the saturated sunsets, to the deep absorbing green of the woods, itâ€™s all fantastically well colored. In a way, reminds me of children's books and how they try at their maximum to captivating the young eyes of children.

Music is mostly atmospheric and in that regard, itâ€™s perfect for adding a thrilling vibe to each area. Sound effects are pretty good and I can only imagine how good would have been to have [b]Jenny LeClue[/b] completely voiced-over, unfortunately and due to probably time and money restrains, the developers opted for a simpler way. Each character will emit an expressive sound, almost like a voice but at the same time not understandable. It blends well with the narrative, but would have been a fantastic addition to have a cast.

A story about family, friends and hopes. Jenny will search and investigate until she finds the truth, about her family and the strange town she lives in. A video-game for all ages, with identity and highly recommended.

review: Great game, with gripping storyline. The locations are all painted beautifully, and are very atmospheric. Love the idea of collecting stickers and scraps of postcards throughout the game. Also nice to be able to read back through the journal to see all the choices you have made and what you have completed so far. Looking forward to the next instalment!

author: {'steamid': '76561198292461573', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 225, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 225, 'last_played': 1573612080}
review: Different mechanics and an awesome storyline make for a great detective game.  I love the detective games and I play tons of point and click puzzle games.  Some of them are are difficult just because you have to walk everywhere to find a wrench that is hidden or something just as dumb.  This game moves along without the stupid seek and find tasks we have grown used to in point and click games.  If you like the detective or the point and click puzzle genre,  give this a try. You just might enjoy it!

review: I backed this game on Kickstarter way back when and even though it took a while to get released, it was totally worth the wait. It's not a perfect game by any means but the story was fun and well written. The puzzles were entertaining and there was just enough variety to keep it from ever getting boring. It wasn't particularly challenging but that didn't decrease my enjoyment at all. The art style is amazing so it's great to look at and the sound design makes it a treat for your ears as well. I highly recommend this game.

review: Excellent art, intuitive controls, and an extremely engaging storyline. The puzzles are tricky but not confounding. I love the entire vibe of the story and personality of the characters overall, especially Jenny. Just a smart, fun game. I've already recommended it to a ton of friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198296660757', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1183, 'last_played': 1573417110}
review:
A really fun adventure game. I love the art style and the writing. I've been playing it with my daughter who absolutely loves it. Family friendly, though you are solving a murder case there's nothing too gory about it. My kid is 9 and she's engaged in the story and can handle the puzzles on her own. It's been great to play through as a family.

Check it out, and support indie devs!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972801091', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 518, 'last_played': 1572219262}
review: A really fun detective story. Game play is quite simple, and puzzles aren't too hard. I liked that everything felt logical in this game, and I didn't have to resort to any helpers for completing the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198011168560', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1572216332}
review: Jenny LeClue has fantastic art direction and a refreshing, engaging story. It's not often that a game just makes me smile in delight at an unexpected animation or twist in the narrative. The puzzles have a perfect level of difficulty for the type of game. It's wonderful that it's kid-friendly, too. If you like puzzle adventures with good stories, you'll certainly enjoy this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085450333', 'num_games_owned': 799, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 709, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1574883259}
review:
Wow. This game is better than I first thought. The game features and author and his creation, a little girl detective. The game starts with him writing his cute stories. Supercute and boring. But then, since his stories are childish and boring, he is about to lose his contract. And so he spices things up a bit. And soon the story becomes weird. And creepy. The author drinks a bottle of wine since killing characters depresses him. A drunk author is actually a good explanation for the story, which gets weirder and weirder ...

The game itself consist of little riddles, most of them very easy. The story is the highlight, not the gameplay. The only weak thing is the ending, it feels abrupt and the cliffhanger could have been done better.

author: {'steamid': '76561198322561841', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 832, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1608841869}
review:
I seriously loved this game! As others have said, the art is BEAUTIFUL. I also enjoyed the mix of difficulty levels on the puzzles: some were quick to figure out & some it took me a little more time. The story was captivating and I definitely lost track of time while I was playing because I just had to keep going and see what was going to happen next.

I also really loved the added bonus of looking for the stickers & postcard scraps. I will be playing again to try & find the pieces I missed on the first run through.

Really looking forward to Chapter Two to continue Jenny's story!

author: {'steamid': '76561198060767070', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 687, 'last_played': 1572744613}
review: This was one of the best games I have ever played! The game follows the story of a young detective, Jenny Leclue, whose goal throughout the game is to save her mother who has been framed for murder. It tells a story of love, loss, friendship, etc. The 2 aspects of this game that really made it enjoyable are the artwork, which was flawless, and the story, which was so engaging that I just kept wanting to play. It has a decent length, about 10 hours, and will be continued with a sequel (which I cannot wait for!) All in all, I highly recommend the game and would love to see more from these game developers.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019466684', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 609, 'playtime_forever': 637, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 637, 'last_played': 1570721206}
review:
[table][th]
Review by [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/34633003-Gaming-Masterpieces/] Gaming Masterpieces [/url]  - The greatest games of all time on Steam. 
[/th][/table]

Is this game a masterpiece? Maybe.

It certainly is a cute, colorful, child-friendly mystery point 'n click adventure with lots of different mini-games, some kind of hidden object searches, (slightly) branching gameplay depending on conversation choices and a very polished presentation. It's a nice investigation game for (younger) hobby detectives.

You (most of the time) play little Jenny, The Worldâ€™s Greatest Detective, solving one puzzle (mini-game) after another. The point'n click parts requiring object manipulation are rather simple, the game mostly advances by solving "quests", which consist of a variety of different mini-game puzzles. Find lost school essays, manipulate a door-opening device, deduct the order of events from clues and so on. I was reminded of Telltale's "Puzzle Agent" series, which follows a similar structure. Jenny has easier puzzles but higher production values, though.

The mystery story is engaging and with fun characters, the puzzles are mostly rather simple and forgiving (no dying), the whole presentation seems to aim at younger players. It's a great game to play with your kids, aged at least 8. Older kids can play alone, as long as they are not overwhelmed by the required reading parts. 

The story is completed, but the game hints at a sequel. After all, Jenny LeClou is a fictional character and the events in this game actually describe the writing of the 30th novel of the (fictional) series.

Works fine with controller.

[u][b] Conclusion:[/b][/u]
Lovely little puzzle game with fantastic art, suitable to play with your kids.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971247793', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 1138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 549, 'last_played': 1602215061}
review:
EDIT: October 2020 - I replayed this game with the new voice acting and enjoyed it even more the second time through. This is definitely one of my favorite adventures of recent memory.

A really lovely little game. The art is fantastic. The story is engaging with fun characters who may start out as simple tropes but reveal depths over time. Gameplay is simplistic and there's not much challenge, but I think that's fine for this sort of thing. And the way the game uses drawing to convey ideas is wonderfully tactile in a way that makes unlocking each puzzle a joy. 

My only concern is that it ends on a cliffhanger and this entry took was a long time coming. I hope the next one can arrive more quickly. I'll definitely be here waiting whenever it comes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026547170', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 852, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 852, 'last_played': 1568953654}
review: Overall I liked the game, I think the story is well developed and is this games strong point.  The game play is a bit simplistic, but I think it suits the type of game it is.  I'm excited to play and demand that a sequel comes out so we can get some more closure to the narrative setup.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970738312', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 826, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 826, 'last_played': 1570343550}
review: I really enjoyed this game up to, but not including the ending. The game is very well designed and I enjoyed playing it immensely. Unfortunately the developers haven't made it clear that this is just the first episode. As a result, the ending is abrupt and confusing. I will certainly play the following chapters when they finally arrive.

author: {'steamid': '76561197987930039', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 687, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 647, 'last_played': 1597580841}
review: I want a sequel. Badly.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056078228', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 760, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 757, 'last_played': 1583983039}
review: Honestly, Jenny LeClue is probably my favorite game I've played. The art style is incredible, the puzzles are incredibly fun and not too difficult, the story is fantastic. As a long time player of the famous female detective game series Nancy Drew, this scratched so many of those same itches but added so many incredible twists. You'll read players complaining about the ending, but I disagree. Yes it is abrupt, but sets up perfectly for a sequel that I am so, so excited for.

author: {'steamid': '76561198331117330', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 703, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 703, 'last_played': 1570345806}
review:
This game was a marvelous gem! I felt like I was solving problems along with Jenny and also like I was writing alongside the author. This title has expanded my repertoire of games. Other titles introduced me to adventure and mystery puzzle solving games, and this game solidified it.
The controls took a little bit to get used to, as Iâ€™m used to using a mouse to interact on a laptop, but once I got the hang of them they started to make sense to me. Earlier today I realized that there is a profound symmetry between the laptop/computer controls (excluding the hand controller from the metaphor), as we just like the author in this story can only interact with this world through the keys on our â€œtypewriterâ€ aka keyboard. 
I look forward to more games from the creators of â€œJenny LeClue Detectivuâ€ in the future.

author: {'steamid': '76561197969899664', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1570299472}
review: Sadly I'm not sure I would recommend the game. It's incredibly repetitive, and it's feels more like watching one big cutscene instead of gameplay. When I first started I was amazed at the art and design, but it's simply not fun after a few hours. I just feel like I'm not really doing anything, or that it's too simplistic. A lot of potential here though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198018686466', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 166, 'playtime_forever': 613, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 613, 'last_played': 1570284893}
review:
Overall I really enjoyed this game. It's very focused on delivering a narrative experience with excellent sound and graphics. If you're expecting a challenging game then you'll be disappointed because it's more like an interactive story than a puzzle game. For what it is, I think it's great game.

However, I was so frustrated at the end when I learned it's a "to be continued" game, which feels doubtful that i'll ever see a second part. The story was almost completely wrapped up by the end of this game; it felt like there was maybe 15 minutes more of closure needed to finish the story when it suddenly just ends. I can't even fathom how there would be enough content for a second game based on how much felt wrapped up. *shrug*

review:
Very charming adventure game. Reminds me of those YA detective novels I used to read as a kid. Puzzles aren't overly challenging, but still satisfying.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037586730', 'num_games_owned': 793, 'num_reviews': 415, 'playtime_forever': 1152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 510, 'last_played': 1633871427}
review: Great detective story, great art & music. The overall sensory identity is fantastic. decent gameplay. The ending was a bit... not there, though.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104520450', 'num_games_owned': 103, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 474, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 474, 'last_played': 1569705380}
review:
Is like any game ever finished when it comes out anymore?

Look i love love love this game and it's clear that it took a ton of work and heart to pull it off as well as it does, but WHY a cliffhanger ending??? I'm not going to care about ANY of it when the resolution comes out in a few months/years/never!

With this and katana zero, I'm beginning to wonder if there's some stigma about releasing a complete game.

It's still worth the buy, obviously you should support this indie darling, but heads-up for the gutpunch cliffhanger.

author: {'steamid': '76561198992753861', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1569434170}
review: I LOVE this game. I continue to be impressed by the storyline, details, and graphics. I truly enjoyed every second of playing. It was 100% worth the wait and the price. I only wish there were a few more "puzzles" throughout the game... Can't wait for another Jenny LeClue!

author: {'steamid': '76561198025750566', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 636, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 635, 'last_played': 1572295282}
review:
The controls are a little funky. The button prompts don't add much. There's occasional bugginess. But the music is good, the visual design is great, and the writing is fantastic. If you like narrative-driven games, plot twists, solving mysteries, or bad jokes... please, please play this game.

Then maybe we'll get a sequel.

author: {'steamid': '76561198060576195', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 571, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 571, 'last_played': 1569620592}
review:
I never write a review but I believe this game deserves one.

First thing is that this game has all the elements a perfect detective story should have making it surprisingly interesting. You keep on going trying to find out where the story goes and discover what really transpired in the tiny town of Arthurton. All the different locations you come across when you play the game only add to the mistery. The athmosphere and artstyle fit in perfectly with the story the game tries to tell you. Even though it is a simple adventure puzzle game I personally started to develop feelings for the colorfull characters. This is something that only brilliant writers can accomplish.

The game doesn't take long to play but the choices you get to make it interesting to play again.

If you have time and like to relax on the couch with a good mistery novel, make sure you buy this game. 
It's totally worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048668312', 'num_games_owned': 11251, 'num_reviews': 311, 'playtime_forever': 561, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 561, 'last_played': 1569591564}
review:
[h1]More interesting reviews on [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/33843777//] Fenol Baron Approves Curator Page[/url] [/h1]

The Worldâ€™s Greatest Detective Jenny LeClue steps in, tremble the villains! The small town of Arthurton will shudder more than once from the sudden illumination of a young detective, and her sharp eyes behind all-seeing glasses will reveal every hidden secret. The barely perceptible vibrations of the Nancy Drew, Night in the Woods series of games are felt very softly and unobtrusively, creating a wonderful feeling of comfort and coziness. We have before us an excellent example of a youthful detective, in which there is enough charming naivety, and touching moments, and frightening discoveries, and the right thoughts about friendship, relationships and interaction with the outside world, which is such an adult, but of course does not understand anything. The game is very plot-oriented, I would not say that there are a lot of puzzles and other gameplay wisdom here, we mainly interrogate, analyze the facts, moving through the story towards the Terrible Secret. The atmosphere of a small town in which nothing happens is perfectly maintained, all the characters are very lively and vibrant, leave a good impression. Communication with them is so easy and relaxed that one wonders how the authors managed to achieve such a result. The story moves at a very measured pace, it is worth noting that the game (especially as for an indie game) has a good duration, most of which is full of events and situations. My only complaint about the story is about the ending - itâ€™s kind of strange, to be honest, but I hope that we will see a sequel that will put everything in its place. Again, in a future game I would like a little more gameplay variety (more different puzzles, for example), so that the action would be even more dynamic. This does not detract from the merits of the game, just tips to make the sequel even more wonderful. And how do you want the badges and backgrounds for this game, with the stunning artwork that is here, this would be an incredible gift.

"Jenny LeClue - Detectivu" is a wonderful, exciting and kind story, created by very talented people. Which obviously invested in it part of their heart and soul, that to please the players, which they did fine and did, I enjoyed the game very much, and now I look forward to continuing!

author: {'steamid': '76561198024376103', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 1025, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1018, 'last_played': 1569563093}
review:
This game was impossibly good, and I am surprised at how I'm looking forward to more. I have a deep appreciation for this game and all its aspects. Wholly worth the wait and the $20 (cost at time of posting). First playthrough netted about 15+ hours of gameplay between actual in-game content and cipher solving both on live-stream and off.

[b]Get Jenny LeClue if you like:[/b] Nancy Drew, Oxenfree, the Blackwell series, story-driven adventure games, investigation adventure games, mysteries, stylized graphics. 

[b]PROS:[/b]
No mouse needed, can be played on a laptop. Multiple layers of experience, both obvious and hidden. Fully encapsulated narrative with enough unanswered questions to make you desire more. Excellent art. Beautiful music. Packed with genuine moments and "Whoa, I'm smart!" puzzles. Tips between classic Nancy Drew-esque investigation and games like Oxenfree.

[b]CONS:[/b]
Lack of direct address commas. I had to put [i]something[/i] here...

[spoiler]Anyone who knows me knows that I hate TBC (to be continued) endings with a fiery passion, because most games use it as an excuse to avoid a mess of an ending. Jenny LeClue has a fully realized and wholly encapsulated narrative that satisfied my need for answers, solving the mystery while simultaneously building a very strong case for a second game. I had a knee-jerk reaction to the ending initially, but the more I thought about it, the more I found that this game delivers on all fronts.[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198012051873', 'num_games_owned': 152, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 922, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 922, 'last_played': 1674848157}
review:
Ich hÃ¤tte gerne einen Daumen zur Seite gewÃ¤hlt fÃ¼r "mittelmÃ¤ÃŸig" aber leider gibt es diesen nicht und eigentlich Ã¼berwog das Positive. 

Erst einmal das Schlechte:
Es ist schade, dass fast nichts aus der Demo und dem Teaser bis zum Release Ã¼berstanden hat. Die tolle Mechanik, kniffligen RÃ¤tsel, das Mystische und vor allem die Maussteuerung (Point 'n Click) wurden nicht Ã¼bernommen. Selbst der Ort wurde nicht ins Spiel gebracht. Jetzt haben wir ein vollkommen anderes Spiel erhalten aber mit den selben Charakteren. Hatte mich sehr auf das, was in der Demo gezeigt wurde, gefreut aber nun ja... Zudem gibt es nur etwa 3 RÃ¤tsel, die sich dann an anderen Stellen im Spiel wiederholen (+1 Rohr-RÃ¤tsel) und nicht sonderlich schwer sind.

Nun das Gute:
Auch wenn es nicht meinen Erwartungen, dem Teaser Trailer und der Demo entsprach, war es ein gutes Spiel! Der schÃ¶ne Stil, die Charaktere und die Entscheidungen, die man fÃ¤llen konnte, waren sehr Ã¼berzeugend. Die Sicht aus einem Autor zu spielen war eine schÃ¶ne, erfrischende Idee und es kam einen fast so vor, als wÃ¼rde man wirklich ein Buch lesen...nur interaktiv...und wir konnten an einigen Stellen entscheiden, wie es weitergeht. Wir waren das Schicksal und der Humor war auch ganz nach meinem Geschmack. Das man sein Notizbuch mit Stickern bekleben konnte, die man im Spielverlauf suchen kann, fand ich auch gut und am Ende hatte ich mein ganzes Buch beklebt, zwischen den ganzen Zeichnungen und Daten von Jenny. Alles in allem ein ausgeglichenes Spiel und als ich meine Erwartungen abgelegt und einfach das Spiel gespielt hatte, fand ich es sehr gut!

Ich freue mich auf eine Fortsetzung, denn die Geschichte ist noch lange nicht zu Ende! :D Vielleicht fÃ¼hlt sich Mografi dann nicht so unter Druck und kann vielleicht die alten Mechaniken aus der Demo wieder hinzufÃ¼gen, sowie einige bessere RÃ¤tsel einbauen.

author: {'steamid': '76561198119007569', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 875, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 764, 'last_played': 1605231037}
review:
Â¡Una enorme aventura! Valio totalmente la espera. Lo preordene a comienzos del 2018 y no estoy para nada decepcionado con el producto. Se nota que es un juego hecho con cariÃ±o, tiene una gran narrativa. Te deja con las ansias de saber que es lo que sigue. 

Mi personaje favorito es Susie, es muy tierna y ojala que haya mas participacion de ella el capitulo 2. En realidad todos los personajes del juego son entraÃ±ables. 

Ojala que en los futuros capitulos hayan mas opciones de personalizacion "Ame la opcion de llenar con pegatinas el diario" pero me hubiera encantado la opcion de personalizar al personaje tambien. Por ejemplo cambiar de atuendos. "Hubiera sido genial que Jenny hubiera aceptado el cambio de ropa que le ofrecio Susie"

Pero en fin, estoy ansioso por la continuacion, vaya final mas bueno! 

Jenny leclue es un juego totalmente recomendado si te encantan las buenas historias.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970730025', 'num_games_owned': 1744, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 654, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 653, 'last_played': 1572545109}
review:
Before I review, I was a kickstarter backer, but if I'd have bought the game, I'd like to have known this first. Some may see it as a spoiler, so I'm using the tags. [spoiler]The game has no ending. Just a 'to be continued'.[/spoiler]

With that out of the way, I found Jenny LeClue to be a fun little adventure. It's strengths exist in it's strong story-writing and absolutely phenomenal artwork and animation. It's a truly beautiful game, and an absolute work of art. For this reason, I'd highly recommend experiencing this title.

With that in mind, and I say this with a heavy heart, as I had such high hopes for this title, the gameplay is what lets the title down. Puzzles are repetitive and simple. If you're along for just the story, then you'll have a great time. If you're looking for challenging puzzles then you won't find them here.

Thanks to Mografi for all their hard work, and I look forward to seeing what's next for them!

author: {'steamid': '76561198215835417', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1949, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1944, 'last_played': 1595436274}

author: {'steamid': '76561198034026303', 'num_games_owned': 597, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 1258, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 918, 'last_played': 1709090949}
review:
First things first, Jenny LeClue is not a LucasArts or Telltale game; if you go in expecting that, you'll be disappointed. It's an interactive novel peppered with puzzles and dialogue choices, akin to Night in the Woods or Oxenfree. With that out of the way, I can safely say that I was quite happy with this purchase. The characters are all well-written and believable, the art style is what made me follow this game way back in 2017, and the mystery had me second-guessing everything all the way to the end and still surprised me.

Second, the murder mystery does not end on a cliffhanger as one review stated. The crime gets solved, and the events and motivations directly connect to things you encounter during play such that you could theoretically figure it out beforehand. However, the ending reveal/monologue scene does raise some world-shattering implications to use as a sequel hook. It's a BIG hook, and the wait for a sequel will be agonizing, but the question you should be asking is "If this sequel never comes out, will I regret buying this?" I sincerely believe that even if Mografi never makes another game, I'll still be happy having bought and played through Jenny LeClue. Certainly not as happy as I'd be if I get to see where they're going with this, but happy nonetheless.




Those two walls of text are what I'd say are the big points, if you're still reading now I'd like to address the common points I saw in negative reviews. First off, yes, the story has a long buildup of little slice of life moments and a metaplot with the author getting lambasted for writing books that are too safe and formulaic. Either you enjoy the slow start, or you don't, personally I feel like the rest of the story doesn't work without getting to see Jenny's world before it all goes to hell.

Second, Jenny is a gigantic antisocial butthead who is constantly dismissive of literally the only person in town trying to help her. She's cocky, a little bit edgy, and nearly dies on at least three occasions. And you know what? I like her. She's written like an outcast teenager who's in over her head, but is too stubborn and deep already to even consider turning back, which is exactly what she is. She'll grow out of some if it, sooner or later depending on how you direct her interactions. Until then, you're controlling a premade character who isn't a paragon of social skills or even basic ethics.

Finally, yes, I do agree that the exploration can be annoying and slow at times. And the occasions where you're forced to walk and/or stop to do minor block and jumping puzzles don't help. I had similar issues with Night in the Woods and Oxenfree, but in all three games I found the story and characters more than engaging enough to forgive the hiccups.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079626599', 'num_games_owned': 141, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 580, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 580, 'last_played': 1571093175}
review: Just finished part 1 and my gosh is this game a gem! It has such a captivating story, which is only enhanced by its lovely characters, great soundtrack by the same composer from OXENFREE, a fantastic art direction, and overall such charm. I definitely recommend Jenny Leclue, especially if you love story-based games with choices such as Life is Strange, Night in the Woods, or OXENFREE.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023541946', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 475, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 475, 'last_played': 1569199514}
review:
I was a kickstarter backer, glad to see it finally out. It really ended up being more of an interactive story or visual novel than a game in the end, which hurts it at times. Would have loved for a bit more meat to some of the puzzles and fewer segments of walking back and forth. However, I found myself sucked into the world and the story thanks to some solid atmosphere and likable characters. Ultimately I had a good time, although I was occasionally frustrated, especially with the lack of resolution. In the end, I'd say it was worth kickstarting, and I'm looking forward to the sequel, although I hope they make some improvements to the formula by then. 

---tl;dr ---
If you like a good story and atmosphere and don't mind that there isn't much actual game, this is a fun ride. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198164168213', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 674, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 672, 'last_played': 1605485864}
review:
I bought this game the day of the release as I had been waiting for it's release for a longggg time (not quite as long as Midnight in Salem, for any Nancy Drew fans out there). 

And holy cow, I was not disappointed. 

Yes, the graphics are beautiful, the story is an amazing fusion of mystery, scifi, and a little bit of horror, and the characters are vivacious and brilliant. But what's most incredible about this game is that the creators have spared no expense to make it extremely user friendly. I was rarely ~stuck in this game. It would remind me where things were after longer puzzles, there were no repercussions for making mistakes, and things made logical sense (which you don't always get in mystery games, surprisingly). 

Not to mention, the collectibles in this game are the best. Stickers you can put on your in game journal? I'm in heaven!

This game is a fusion of A Night In the Woods, Oxenfree , and The Low Road, all put into a Nancy Drew formula. Jenny LeClue is my new favorite Heroine and I cannot wait to continue her story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029292678', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 558, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1569358466}
review:
I have been waiting for the game release for more than a year. And now it is finally out! And I love it so far! 

Overall, I'd describe it as an interactive story with great writing and beautiful unique art-style. I also love how dynamic sounds and music smartly highlight important gameplay of events and actions. 

Keep in mind, that the game would not probably offer much for hardcore puzzle solvers. As I said before, it feels more like an interactive story. 

Also, it looks like a real teen/child-friendly game. So, you might consider buying it for your kid or to play it together.

author: {'steamid': '76561198377718438', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 626, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 625, 'last_played': 1569176337}
review:
Love this game! I've been watching and waiting for it to come out for a long time and it was worth the wait. The art, story, and everything was super compelling and it was everything that I, personally, want from games. The game played longer than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise. I can tell the makers put a lot of heart and soul and love into the game. I want more!!! 

As others mentioned, the biggest negative for me was that it ends with a cliffhanger. To be continued. I'm definitely excited for more. But going into it I didn't know that that was part of the game creator's plan. I will say NOT knowing that definitely made the ending more shocking. Maybe that's why it wasn't advertised as Episode 1? 

I also didn't know that they were intending to add voices to the game play, or that that's something coming in an update in the future. I don't feel like the lack of voices detracted from the game at all. I personally enjoyed it without them and don't think they're needed. But I'm sure it will be super fun to it play again when they're added.

Anywho, someone please give them more money so they can finish the story ASAAP! It looks like on their Kickstarter Episode 2 and 3 were stretch goals that were never reached. Which makes me nervous, so I really hope that they get the funding they need to finish the story!

With all that being said, even if Episode 2 and 3 were never to see the light of day, Episode 1 is well worth the play and a piece of art on its own and was a true joy and experience to play. I loved it. Thanks y'all!

author: {'steamid': '76561197972383201', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 745, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 745, 'last_played': 1569102990}
review:
Played through all of it yesterday. The game is an absolute delight. Do not get deterred by the seeming slow start. It picks up the pace and takes a left turn into humorous Mystery Nancy Drew land after a short hour.

The visual style, the twisting storyline, the dialogue are all top notch. 

There are a few gameplay elements which just involve repeatedly mashing the same button for a few seconds but they are quickly passed.

Overall,  really worth it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197970556751', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1704, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 747, 'last_played': 1635901440}
review:
What a lovely game, through and through. The visual style is absolutely unparalleled. I loved the framing of Jenny's story within Arthur's, I laughed out loud at a whole bunch of dialogue, the music made me smile all the time, and without spoiling anything, let's just say that the weirder elements of the plot really intrigued and engaged me - they felt right at home in this story.

I wish there were a save system instead of autosaves, and I wish there were some sort of mouse support. Neither of these small gripes blocked me from having a great time, and I can't wait to get back into it again, with different choosiness!

author: {'steamid': '76561198023125803', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 1584, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 792, 'last_played': 1621748880}
review:
Is the game a challenge for adults? 
Nope.
Is the game something seasoned game fans can sink hours upon hours into? 
Nope.

Does it control well? 
I screwed up a couple times, but that was on me.
Is the gameplay fun? 
Sure is.
Is the story good? 
You bet your sweet ass it is!
Do you get to make interesting decisions? 
;)
Are the characters likeable?
I WOULD DIE FOR JENNY.
Is it aesthetically pleasing?
HAVE YOU LOOKED AT IT??

HIGHLY recommended, if you like mystery adventures, and adorable kid detectives.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065744985', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 12, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1569083329}
review:
Ich habe dieses Spiel seinerzeit auf Kickstarter unterstÃ¼tzt. Prinzipiell klang es damals nach einem guten Point & Click Adventure mit einem interessantem Art-Stil. Als dann nach Jahren die das Projekt hinter seinem Zeitplan lag (es hÃ¤tte urspr. schon im Dezember 2016 erscheinen sollen, die Kickstarter-Kampagne war immerhin 2014 erfolgreich) dann doch endlich ein Release-Datum kam, war ich schon erstaunt genug, denn hier hÃ¤tte ich eigentlich nicht mehr Ã¼berhaupt mit einem Erscheinen gerechnet.

WÃ¤hrend der ganzen Jahre kamen immer mal wieder Updates rein, die auch oftmals mit Entschuldigungen fÃ¼r die VerzÃ¶gerung des Projektes gefÃ¼llt waren ("Wir sind nur ein kleines Entwickler-Team..." und so weiter und so fort..). Aber im Gegenzug kamen immer wieder mal Updates rein, wie toll es ist, mit dem Spiel auf z.B. der Playstation-Experience von Sony dabei zu sein. Hier sehe ich den Fokus des Team falsch ausgerichtet: lieber PR-Events besuchen als am Produkt zu arbeiten...

Hatte also schon mal einen bitteren Beigeschmack. Dass man angeblich nur ein kleines Team ist (Bemerkung am Rande: in der Kickstarter-Kampagne waren als Team 12 Personen gelistet) ist schonmal eine nette Aussage, da man hier offensichtlich in der Kickstarter-Kampagne gelogen hat, wenn es am Ende doch nur 3 waren. Mit 12 wÃ¤re eine solche VerzÃ¶gerung nicht zu erklÃ¤ren.

Aber lange Rede, kurzer Sinn: diesem Entwickler werde ich bestimmt nie wieder auch mit nur einen Cent bei egal welchem Projekt unterstÃ¼tzen.

Zum Spiel selbst kann ich nicht viel sagen, weil es fÃ¼r mich durch die "Steuerung" schlichtweg eine Tortur ist gespielt zu werden. Das ganze ist mit einem absoluten Fokus auf Controller programmiert worden, der aus dem was ich bisher gesehen habe eine lange Kette von Mini-Spielen macht. Wenn man ein Adventure erwartet und dann sowas bekommt, dann ist es noch hÃ¶flich zu sagen, dass man sein Geld verschwendet hat. Nicht mal in den MenÃ¼s hat man eine Mauszeiger-Steuerung.

Die Jahre die sich das ganze hier verzÃ¶gert hat spiegeln sich nicht wirklich wieder. Andere Kickstarter-Projekte (ebenfalls von kleinen Teams) kamen lange nach diesem und waren lange vor ihm fertig (und lieferten dabei viel aufwendigere Grafik, Steuerung und Gameplay).

author: {'steamid': '76561198394082543', 'num_games_owned': 1005, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 562, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 489, 'last_played': 1621909374}
review:
This positively one of the best games I've ever played.

I personally felt like I was playing a proper Sherlock Holmes game. I felt invested in the story, the art is absolutely gorgeous and the twist/ending has my jaw absolutely dropped on the floor.

My favorite part was exploring the areas in the game to find new, hidden secrets especially when they could help the ultimate mystery of what in the actual heck is going on in Arthurton.

If I had one major nitpick, it was that it felt too short. But for all I know, this is secretly an episodic game.

Overall 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197978326395', 'num_games_owned': 1310, 'num_reviews': 71, 'playtime_forever': 641, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 641, 'last_played': 1569079622}
review:
Good game.
Looks gorgeous, sound/music is fine :) 
Puzzles are good, at least once, don't think some of them needed to be repeated that often.
And If it had actually had an ending it would have been an amazing story as well, really want to know what happens next ... just don't know when that will be... hopefully faster than the 5 years part 1 took.
Also If it is an episodic game mention it in the game description or in the title...

author: {'steamid': '76561197994062567', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 708, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 648, 'last_played': 1569074015}
review:
I rarely post any reviews, actually, but this game really deserve one.
Perfectly charming story, nice dialogues, and (despite many opinions) not tedious and repetiteve gameplay - if you put your time to actually read and not just jump from one puzzle to another. I will replay it once more in a week or so, just to try another dialogue options and see if they matter. But anyway, it is fantastic job - my respect to gamedev on this one.

Highly recommended to people who like to read (with no offense to any other kind - you may actually like this game for platformer part, for example).

5/5
Will buy next part, if it's planned :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198451653990', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1569070979}
review: Played an hour so far. I've been looking forward to this game for a very long time. Unfortunately it feels like watching an episode of a slow TV-show so far. No real choices, no puzzles thus far, just pushing the buttons the game tells you to.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999613406', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 409, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 379, 'last_played': 1570020348}
review:
A gripping tale of intrepid detectivity and harrowing adventure, bursting with style, deduction, and conveniently sturdy tree roots.

Can I trade in my stack of old hardy boys/three investigators/nancy drew books, and get another Jenny LeClue adventure? While I haven't finished the game yet, it's been a wild ride so far.

Puzzles aren't ultra complex, but neither are they trivial - while they feel balanced on the "keep things moving" side, I found many had an element that needed a little thought. The deductions are done in a "you unearth the clues, and identify the key linkages, then Jenny reasons it out" style. For at least a couple of them it looked like there may have been alternate viable linkages, but haven't yet had a chance to replay and find out.

author: {'steamid': '76561197999385812', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 590, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 590, 'last_played': 1569013222}
review:
This game is cutely drawn, surprisingly dark, intriguingly written, and a joy to play and experience. The puzzling is a little less than I wanted, in that there are only a few places I felt challenged. By the end, though, I realized a lot of the game was in experiencing everything and gathering clues, clues that you use later on to solve "cases" (basically puzzles of deduction).

My only real caveat is that this is part 1 and the game ends on a cliffhanger. This seems like something you should know going in.

---

Also, I noticed another review stated that the game doesn't indicate when it autosaves. It does, with a little Jenny LeClue logo in the lower left of the screen. BUT the game never explained this, so it was something I had to figure out on my own. The game also saves quite regularly, so you'll never be giving up much progress beyond the most immediate puzzle.

author: {'steamid': '76561198014471504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1352, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 568, 'last_played': 1597328374}
review:
Note: When I wrote this review, Jenny LeClue had no voice acting, which is why the review doesn't mention it. The game recently updated with the voice acting. It is extremely good, and on this replay, I can't imagine going back to no voices. It turned a great game into an exceptional one.
-
Jenny LeClue is positively adorable. The eponymous hero, yes- exceedingly so- but also the game itself is just overall incredibly charming.

As far as gameplay goes, it's nothing you haven't seen before. There's a lot of conversations between Jenny and the various residents of Arthurton, as she walks about a 2d world, flicking switches and pushing boxes. There's some neat investigation sections that will feel very familiar to fans of Danganronpa or Phoenix Wright.
There's absolutely nothing wrong with how the game plays, but it's really just the way everything else- the art, the characters, the narrative- are delivered, and nothing more.

What starts as a fairly mundane adventure in the shoes of a bratty child detective relatively quickly goes off the deep end, and just keeps on diving down until you're forced to accept you'll never take another breath. 
You navigate Jenny through increasingly traumatic experiences, and she jots them all down in her journal (adding personal notes in the margins every time she makes a discovery or nearly dies)

And it is still adorable, despite the bizarrely dark places the narrative goes. Jenny picks locks with her hairclip like a little MacGyver. The in universe author of Jenny's world becomes increasingly depressed and turns to alcohol to cope.  You can put stickers all over Jenny's detective notebook. There's a lot of actual corpses!

Cute and horrifying as the game can be, however, it's not free of its actual issues.

For one thing, there's only the one save slot- that's always annoying, especially in games with so many choices. Said choices don't appear to be hugely important generally, but I've only played through the one time so I can't say that with confidence. 
Either way, it would be nice to be able to have a few backup save slots, in part because of the other issue, a weird bug in which the journal would record my choices incorrectly, leaving me unsure of whether or not my choice would be correctly rewarded if it were to come up again.

Much more importantly, though, the game ends on a cliffhanger, with a promise of a followup title. The ending is abrupt, and comes immediately after a choice that will leave you feeling cheated.
This might not be an issue except that the game took like. Five years to come out? So I'm a little hesitant to get excited about a sequel that for all I know will take another five. The store page didn't mention the lack of a proper ending, and there's been no communication about how long the sequel will potentially take, which is frustrating.

Despite these problems, I still absolutely recommend Jenny LeClue. It's cute and good, and disappointing mostly in that I wanted more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020870325', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1329, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 695, 'last_played': 1569334242}
review:
I've waited 4 years for this game to come out. I had it on my wishlist the second I saw the first trailer. That the game got delayed a ton had me a bit miffed but damn was it worth it.
"A game that gets delayed is eventually good, a game that is rushed is bad forever." - Someone i guess

The story is even more engaging than I expected from the trailers, gameplay seems a bit simple so far but the story and humor make up for that, I just want to keep going and going and find out what's going on.

The aesthetics are the epitome of beauty. Rarely does a game make me gush over its aesthetics to myself while I'm playing and I find myself regularly just standing still and taking in the scenery. It's simply beautiful.

One thing I'm a bit sad about is that there's no voice acting. I really liked the actor who voiced the author of the book series in the trailer and was hoping the game would feature him and maybe others. But alas, it was not meant to be. But that is only a small bump in the road for this otherwise just wonderfully beautiful and entertaining adventure.

author: {'steamid': '76561198029927145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 712, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 407, 'last_played': 1569073552}
review:
Ich liebe den Look des Spiels, seit ich es das 1x gesehen habe!

Die Geschichte ist charmant und die Charaktere sind liebenswert. Das Ganze hat etwas von einem interaktiven Jugendbuch, mit dem ich bisher viel Freude habe.

Ich mag die Gimmicks, wie die Sticker, mit denen man sein Notizbuch komplett verzieren kann. Die NotizbucheintrÃ¤ge und FallauflÃ¶sungen sind einfach cool. Das alles zu Lokalisieren muss hart gewesen sein. Es funktioniert zu groÃŸen Teilen sehr gut.

Wer ein Spiel sucht, bei dem er alles Ã¤ndern kann, ist hier falsch: es handelt sich um ein klassisches Adventure mit Controllersteuerung und recht wenigen ItemrÃ¤tseln.

Ich bin jetzt bei 60-75% angekommen und kann nur sagen: super Leistung, liebe Entwickler! <3

author: {'steamid': '76561198094616067', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 190, 'last_played': 1595596789}
review: Wow, great experience! Jenny LeClue really creates an immersive atmosphere. It's the kind of game I'd want to play during a thunderstorm. The visuals are SO cool and unique. The world feels rich, and the large variety of characters add so much personality. There's a nice balance between story and gameplay that puts you in control while also delivering on a narrative that feels well crafted. Recommended!

author: {'steamid': '76561198020730354', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1633479032}
review:
As a Kickstarter backer of this game, I really wanted to love it. It has a lot going for it. The visual style is distinct, and the graphics are very pretty. The music is moderately okay. There's an attempt to make a reasonable framing backstory. 

Unfortunately, none of those could save the experience for me.

The control scheme is horribly designed (genuinely, did ANYONE playtest this, even once?), poorly (and often just plain incorrectly) explained, and inconsistent.

There's no way to save your game. The game autosaves periodically, but there's no manual save function AND no indication of when it autosaves. It will, however, happily inform you of how much gameplay you're going to lose if you quit.

Perhaps worst is that there are giant swaths of the game where you're just watching a cut scene but where the game comes up with irritating ways to attempt to "gameify" it by adding in pointless tasks that don't actually involve any gameplay. "Hold ENTER for 10 seconds, then tap it seven times to continue watching the cutscene." Uh, how about I just play an actually-fun game instead?

And even that could be worth putting up with if it were wrapped in a story that really grabs you from the get-go, but in the first half hour of game play it's still just a very boring and bland story about an author being condemned for writing a very boring and bland story.

I can usually come up with a, "If you like X or Y, you might still enjoy this game," but I can't honestly say who I'd recommend this game to, if anyone. Maybe it's good for young kids who enjoy the art, so long as they're patient with unexplained or misleading controls.

author: {'steamid': '76561198191702494', 'num_games_owned': 1079, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 748, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 138, 'last_played': 1582761368}
review:
This game is amazing! 
Never hav I ever had such good character writing in games. You can immediatly know what kind of person the characters are.

Great visuals! Great art! Great puns!

It's BEAN amazing so far!
Absolutely love it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198079260383', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 443, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 443, 'last_played': 1568931751}
review:
You should title this game as Jenny LeClue - Detectivu PART 1.
7 hours of gameplay is filled with repetitive walking, and mini-games.
I liked visual aspect of this game.
but TO BE CONTINUED ending is not what I expected.

review: I have had this game in my wishlist for a very long time. I was excited to see it had come out today. I've played about half an hour and I'm already in love with the story, characters, and gameplay. It is a true detective and investigation game and something I wish there was a lot more of on Steam. Congrats to the developers for sticking through the long development and delivering such a great looking mystery game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040528007', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 348, 'last_played': 1568926912}
review:
Uff. It's kind of heartbreaking writing a bad review for a game that I know the developers fought hard for to make, I mean, game industry and game making isn't an easy task.

But the truth is.. I feel like this game, isn't nearly as amazing as it looks. The art style is beautiful, and the tongue-in-cheek humor and writing is STELLAR. I feel the narrative itself is strong, but the game feels like it drags on after a while and the game becomes painfully long and starts to lag, because the gameplay isn't there (and I believe that's by design), but that lack of gameplay becomes it's fatal flaw, as the game then starts to drag out unneccessairly.

The puzzles are repetitive, and few to begin with. The movement is very restricted, with very little to explore.

I feel that when someone heads out to make a game about a mystery, there should be an ACTUAL mystery, instead, this just feels like a story being played out in-front of you, which is all good, but I feel that it would have been an amazing animation movie rather than a "game".

I guess it's still an "interactive experience", but I feel that said experience is far from perfect, and the game's only saving grace is its writing and humor.
